24001.name: Supernase
24001.description: Players have to recognize a gang of 4 gangsters on the variable gameboard by using dog shaped templates. Pretty innovative game for the year it was published and probably one of the best games by Detlef Wendt.

24002.name: Pirate King
24002.description:
Pirate King is a game where players take on the roles of pirate captains. Players sail around the Caribbean trying to become the Pirate King by smuggling cargo and capturing territories.

Players set sail by choosing how far they would like to move each turn and roll a d12 to determine how far they will move. Rolling too low or too high will cause a player to overshoot or undershoot his or her target, but a good roll will hit a player right where he or she wants to go. Wherever a player lands on a territory, he or she has choices to make about what actions to take, whether that be to capture the port, pay the owner a dock fee, or attempt to wrest control of the port from the current owner. Players draw cards that have good or bad effects on the Pirate's Booty or Captain's Log spaces, and further spaces have effects on players
Players gain points by holding territories, having Great Treasures, or by defeating the Commodore. The game is over when a player has 16 points.

24003.name: Legions of the Petal Throne
24003.description:
Rules for conducting miniatures battles on the world of Tekumel (the setting of the fantasy role playing game "Empire of the Petal Throne"and the more recent "Tekumel: The World of the Petal Throne"). The single booklet contains basic and advanced rules for 25 mm miniatures on a 1:100 scale. The advanced rules describe the particular powers and military formations of the five great human empires and the various non-human races. Other rules govern the use of magic and ancient technological devices.

TSR first published the rules in 1977. Tita's House of Games later republished the booklet. These were the first published miniatures rules for the Tekumel universe. Later rules were "Missum!" and "Qadardalikoi."

24004.name: Missúm!
24004.description:
Rules for conducting miniatures combat on the world of Tekumel (the setting of the RPG "Empire of the Petal Throne" and the more recent "Tekumel: World of the Petal Throne"). These 1:100 figure scale rules for 25mm minatures succeeded the earlier "Legions of the Petal Throne" booklet.

These rules were first published by The Imperium Publishing Company and have been reprinted by Tita's House of Games. Later supplements contained army statistics for the armies of the major human empires and non-human races. Another, more detailed, set of Tekumel miniature rules, "Qadardalikoi," was published in 1983.

24005.name: Qadardalikoi
24005.description:
Rules for conducting miniatures battles on the world of Tekumel (the setting for the RPG "Empire of the Petal throne" and the more recent "Tekumel: The world of the Petal Throne"). These rules for 1:100 figure scale 25mm miniatures battles are much more detailed than the two earlier Tekumel miniature rules sets: "Legions of the Petal Throne" and Missum!" Qadardalikoi also includes campaign rules and is compatible with the army statistics contained in later supplements.

First published in 1983 by Tekumel Games, the booklet has been republished by Tita's House of Games.

24006.name: The F.B.I. Game
24006.description:
Each Player is a 2 man team of F.B.I. agents assigned to investigate the scene of a crime and gather evidence against the guilty fugitive hiding in a distant city. When a player correctly identifies 4 pieces of evidence, the guilty fugitive will fit into their center as easily as a piece in a jig-saw puzzle. First player to obtain 4 pieces of evidence fitting a fugitive on 2 sides, arrests the criminal, brings him into headquarters wins.

Contents:
8 F.B.I. Agents in 4 colors with black wooden bases
4 Fugitives with 4 colored wooden bases
4 Assignment cards
64 Evidence pieces (16 in each case file)
1 Airport Spinner
20 F.B.I. Bulletins
1 Magnifying glass
2 dice
1 dice cup

24007.name: Once Upon a Castle
24007.description: From the publisher: Race to construct your own castle! Once upon a time there lived a Princess and a Knight who both wanted to rule their kingdom. But only one ruler was allowed, so they decided to have a race. Whoever can build their castle first may claim victory! But watch out, the mischievous Ogre wants to spoil their plans. Who will escape his antics and become ruler of the land?

24009.description:
The classic naval combat game has gone vertical! Wage a decisive sea battle on the multi-level grid, with more ships, added powers, and more ways to sink the enemy. Special game rules give ships multiple power options. To win, sink all of your enemy's ships -- before he sends yours to Davy Jones' locker!

Re-implements:

Battleship
24009.name: Battleship Command: Pirates of the Caribbean

24010.name: La meva col·lecció
24010.description:
Overview and objectives

The players try to get at least 9 art pieces from different museums in Barcelona, in order to build their own art collection, placing it in their own "shelves". To achieve that, the players must drop pieces they don't want while trying to obtain the ones needed.

Game components

54 tokens (square cardboard cards) representing 54 art pieces from different museums of Barcelona and surroundings. Each token is identified by a number, a color and a category. There are 4 colors and 4 categories.
2 tokens representing a thief.




Rules

Shuffle all tokens. Each player draws 3 tokens from the pile with all tokens shuffled and keeps them in his hand. Then, as many tokens as players in the game are picked from the pile and put in front of them in the "showroom". The players use one of their tokens for bidding for the showroom tokens: the one with the highest number chooses first which piece of the "showroom" he gets. The tokens used for betting are discarded. At this moment each player can add one of the tokens in his hand to his own collection "shelf". Finally each player draws new tokens from the pile to have 3 again.

The critical point is that the shelf can only be filled following a certain pattern: each token must be of the same color or the same category as the previous one, and to completely fill in the "shelf" the player must have, at least, one token of each color and one token of each category.

The first player to complete his collection of 9 pieces is the winner.

24011.name: Maths Me!
24011.description:
This game is designed by a Singaporean company, Camelot Hobbies. Players try to get rid of cards in their hands by playing cards that fit the mathematical conditions at the time. The game comes with a deck of 39 cards and two special six-sided dice (the dice show 1,1,2,3,+ and -).

From the rules:


Object of the Game

To be the Greatest, just be the first to discard all your Maths Me! cards! To do this, players place them in turn in a centre discard-pile according to the 'condition' of the play at the time.

One pack of Maths Me! cards is just right for 2-4 players. For more than 4 players, just add another pack!

Game Structure

Maths Me! is a mathematical symbol game that revolves around placing valid cards according to one of the 2 prevailing conditions, "Greater Than" or "Less Than". The prevailing condition refers to the current flow of the game. During "Greater Than", players must place cards which continually increase the numerical value being played (e.g. 47, 63, 89, 92 ...). On the other hand, when the prevailing condition is "Less Than", numbers must become smaller and smaller.



The game came with a sticker indicating the National Parenting Center Seal of Approval 1997 (The Camelot Hobbies website gives the year for the seal of approval as 1996).

URL for Camelot Hobbies website: http://www.camelot.com.sg/

24012.name: Oenologus
24012.description:
The Union de la Sommellerie Française (French Union of Sommeliers) created this wine-trivia as a relation gift. The nice wooden box contains a map of France, 6 bottle-meeples, 1 die and 8 sets of 44 cards. On each card, you find 3 questions on wine (in general or questions about a wine region).
Players have to roll the die and answer a question. If the answer is correct, you can play again. If wrong, next players starts rolling the die.
Winner is that player who comes first at the ending point.

24013.description:
Bitter Victory: The Invasion of Sicily, 1943 is a Brigade-level, hex-and-counter wargame covering the 1943 Allied invasion of Sicily.

The game uses the chit-pull activation system previously employed in America Triumphant, Red God of War and Alsace 1945. Players alternate pulling HQ activation chits and moving/fighting with the corresponding combat units. HQ units must be able to trace supply lines for their units to be able to fight and move at their highest efficiency. The game adds rules for amphibious landings and airborne drops.

Four scenarios are provided:

1) Operation Husky -- the historical invasion plan where Monty races to Messina to cut off the German escape while Patton supposedly covers his flank.

2) A "free setup" scenario where both sides may freely deploy their defenders/choose invasion sites.

3) What-if scenario "141 Plan" -- Fewer troops are employed than in the historical invasion, and they assault at opposite ends of the island

4) What-if scenario "Tunisian Followup"--an invasion taking place earlier than the historical landings--immediately following the conquest of North Africa.

Victory points are earned for eliminating enemy units, repelling and landings and airdrops, evacuating units from Messina, and controlling key cities.
24013.name: Bitter Victory:  The Invasion of Sicily, 1943

24014.description:
From the Publishers website:

The War in the Western Desert of Egypt is the focus of the ‘Desert Rats’ of the British Army and its Imperial allies as the third year of the war draws to a close. Here they fight General Rommel, the legendary ‘Desert Fox’ and his Afrika Korps and Italian allies.

As this heroic struggle plays out, the US Army enters the fray for the first time, landing in Algeria and Morocco behind Rommel’s forces. Trapped between two foes the Desert Fox does the only thing possible, he attacks!

This book enables you to recreate the famous battles of El Alamein, Kasserine pass, Sicily and Salerno with the Flames Of War the World War II Miniatures Game.

INSIDE YOU WILL FIND:

• Complete organization and equipment for all the forces in the Mediterranean Theater, 1942-43.


• An overall history of what happened in the theater, as well as individual histories of the nations involved.
• Guides to German, Italian, British and US Divisions in North Africa, Sicily and Italy.
• Inspiring color photos.
• Comprehensive painting guides.
• Airborne assault mission to use with your German and US paratroops.
• Exploits of inspirational historic figures such as Captain Charles Upham, Technical Sergeant ‘Commando’ Kelly, Tenente Luigi Pascucci and Generalfeldmarschall Erwin Rommel.

Flames of War current rulebook range
24014.name: Flames of War: Afrika

11168.name: Flames of War: The World War II Miniatures Game

24015.name: Gong Fermer's Revenge
24015.description:
The Year is 1349 AD. As Gong Fermer inspects his useless crop of rotten vegetables, he simmers with frustration. He’s quite aware that he’s the poorest, lowliest wretch in this god-forsaken village—and has the ripe, brown stains on his tattered shirt to prove it. But just to make sure he remembers, the villagers laugh and spit in his face every day, reveling in his misery. As if crappy crops weren’t enough!

The excitement begins when Gong decides that he’s taken enough crap for one lifetime. Even with the Black Plague killing peasants and noblemen at record speed, Gong decides to take the King’s justice into his own hands, with nothing but his battered pride, his trusty dung shovel, and a rusty bucket! The King’s battalion of armored knights, archers, and soldiers stand ever ready… an entire army of seasoned warriors. What chance does Gong have against such wealth and might? Nonetheless, a word festers in the back of Gong’s mind: revolt!

You and your friends will have a blast recreating medieval life by playing this fast pace, strategic and addicting card game where nothing is as it seems, nor as it should be. Instead of singing the praises of "Long live the King", you will joyfully cry out, "Down with the King, and may Gong Fermer reign!"

24016.description:
From the Publisher's website:

“This war is not an ordinary war. It is the war of the entire Russian people. Not only to eliminate the danger hanging over our heads, but to aid all people groaning under the yoke of Fascism” ~ Josef Stalin

“The Russian colossus ...has been underestimated by us... whenever a dozen divisions are destroyed the Russians replace them with another dozen.” ~ General Franz Halder - Army Chief of Staff

The seemingly unstoppable German Blitzkrieg— which threatened to sweep away the ill-prepared Red Army in the first year of war—has been checked. Now freshly raised Soviet Divisions are launching ever more bold counterattacks against the multinational Axis invaders. As more and more Axis troops race to reinforce the hard-pressed front line, the conflict on the Ostfront (Eastern Front), dubbed the Great Patriotic War by the Soviets, is rapidly escalating to become the greatest conflict in human history.

INSIDE YOU WILL FIND:

• History of the Eastern Front campaign.
• Complete organization for 13 different German company types and variants.
• Complete organization for 12 different company types for Germany’s Eastern Front Allies; the Finns, Hungarians, Italians and Romanians.
• History of Germany’s Eastern Front Allies.
• Complete organization for 13 different Soviet Battalion types and variants.
• Inspiring color photographs and artwork.
• Comprehensive painting and modeling guides.

Flames of War current rulebook range
24016.name: Flames of War: Ostfront

11168.name: Flames of War: The World War II Miniatures Game

24018.name: Prisoner Cell Block H Card Game
24018.description:
Prisoner Cell Block H Card Game 2nd Edition is a fast paced 'Print and Play' Card Game for 2 or more players. Players will take it in turns to draw a card, or play a card, hoping to be the first to get all of their inmates out of Wentworth Detention Centre. They can attempt to escape, or be paroled, but whichever option they take, it won't be easy as other inmates and even prison officers attempt to scupper their plans.

The 2nd Edition of this game includes new cards, more inmates, more officers, and even a new 'Top Dog' variant allowing one Prisoner to rule over fellow inmates.

The Prisoner Cell Block H 2nd Edition game cards and rules can be downloaded for free, from the game files section below. There are 108 cards in the Main Deck and 54 cards in the Prisoner deck.

Prisoner Cell Block H is a copyrighted property. This is an unauthorized, unofficial game produced merely for the entertainment of fans and is non-profit making.

24019.name: Strike!
24019.description: This seems to be an educational(?) game for helping people understand unions; per the brief look at the rulebook - Players represent a union or group of unions. The object is to organize workers and win benefits for your union members - at the same time you must keep your union financially stable.

24020.description:
BlitzWar is a World War Two strategic game set in the European and North African theater of operations which provides a high level of historical simulation with shorter games and with simpler rules than other games currently available.

The main goal of BlitzWar is to provide strategy game lovers with an exciting game. This is largely provided by the number of decisions to be taken along with a great choice of action, although these will normally follow historical ones.
24020.name: Blitzwar

24021.description:
Taken from the box:

OLYMPIAD - The Game of Champions -
Will take you to the biggest and greatest sport spectacular in the world!!

As you strive to be the fastest, highest, or strongest, your one aim is to become Champion of five OLYMPISPORTS - Champion of the Games.

Take the exciting challenge for MEDALS with a simple roll of the dice or with questions to test your knowledge. You will compete the all-time greats of the modern era, in your favorite sporting events.

Collect vital points for each of your achievements on the track or in the field, with PARALYMPISPORTS or in the final sprint of the games. The Champion will not be known until the final sprint is won!!
24021.name: Olympiad, the Game of Champions

24022.description:
As taken from the box:

What would you do if you found a creature that you have never seen before? What if you spotted a Tasmanian Tiger??! What can we do about foxes and feral cats? How would you save "Bilby"...The rabbit-eared Bandicoot from extinction?

These situations and more are posed in this fun family game of danger and rescue. As a result, kids will love putting their parents, friends and teachers on the right track of helping to save endangered Australian animals and plants from extinction.

On The Brink...is a game which is fully funded by the Australian Nature Conservation Agency, as a means of enlightening every Australian to the desperate plight of our endangered Australian species.
24022.name: On The Brink

24023.name: The Game of Midlothian, VA
24023.description: This is a version of Monopoly put out in Midlothian, VA. It features businesses local to the area, such as Ukrop's, Kabuto,and out of business Heilig-Meyers. Illustrations are by Cynthia B. Guerra.

24024.description:
Are you ready for an intergalactic showdown? Attacktix is a battle figure game that combines great action figures with kinetic battling features.

Each figure comes on a base that contains information such as speed, defense, point value, and special powers unique to that character. The goal of the game is simple – be the last one standing.

This version is based on characters in Transformers Universe.

There are multiple themes in the Attacktix series of games.
24024.name: Attacktix Battle Figure Game: Transformers

boardgamehonor.8853: 2007 Golden Geek Best Children's Board Game Nominee

24025.description:
Attacktix is a battle figure game that combines great action figures with kinetic battling features.

Each figure comes on a base that contains information such as speed, defense, point value, and special powers unique to that character. The goal of the game is simple – be the last one standing.

This version is based on characters in the Marvel Universe.

There are multiple themes in the Attacktix series of games.
24025.name: Attacktix Battle Figure Game Marvel Superheroes

24026.name: Flower of Chivalry: A Guide to the Late Middle Ages

boardgamefamily.6377: Canadian Wargamers Group Miniatures Rules Series

24026.description:
Flower of Chivalry is an excellent source book for the miniatures gamer interested in English medieval warfare. The book begins with 14 pages devoted to medieval weapons and armor, battle and siege tactics and heraldry. Next the author provides a simple set of miniatures rules and army lists for gaming battles of the period. The majority of the book is a set of battle scenarios from the Scottish Wars (late 1200's - 1350), the Hundred Years War (1350 - 1450) and the Wars of the Roses (1450 - 1500). Each scenario has a map of the battlefield, lists of units, and special scenario rules. (A solo scenario of the battle of Castillon is included.)

The miniatures rules are designed for 1 unit = 5-800 men, 1" = 40 yds., and 1 turn = 20 minutes. Conversion rules for Tactical, DBA, and WRG 7th edition are also included for those wishing to play with other rules sets.

24027.name: Patton Takes Command, the Tunisian Campaign, 1942-43
24027.description:
An operational level game on the Tunisian Campaign in 1942 and 1943. Ground scale is 5 miles per hex, counters represent brigades and regiments.

Development of this game is currently on hold.

24028.name: Rukshuk
24028.description:
Players race against the clock to build different Rukshuk rock formations and score as many points as they can.
Game cards reveal different Rukshuk formations, bonus points and rules.
Skill, luck and strategy determine who scores the most points and wins!

How to play:


Each player selects seven game rocks from the pouch.
Game rocks are worth different points based on their ‘stack-ability’.
Players score regular and bonus points by using the rocks to build all or part of the Rukshuk formation shown on the game card in 60 seconds or less.
If a player’s Rukshuk formation topples before time expires, he must quickly rebuild it.
When time runs out, players use the score pad to tally the points from their formations.
Once scores are counted the players select new rocks, turn over the next card and build a new Rukshuk


Re-implemented by:

Rukshuk: Edition 2

24030.name: Batman Rooftop Rumble Skill and Action Game
24030.description:
From the publisher:

Young superheroes can join in the adventure with this board game inspired by the Batman animated series. The board game has a 3-D structure with multiple levels. Includes two fully sculpted and painted Batman movers, nine thugs and one super bad guy mover. Defeat the thugs and score points by launching Batman into action using the Batapult, and four score markers. For two to four players

24031.name: For God, King and Country:  A Guidebook to the English Civil Wars

boardgamefamily.6377: Canadian Wargamers Group Miniatures Rules Series

24031.description:
"For God, King and Country" is designed to be an introductory miniatures guide to the English Civil Wars. The first part of the book gives an overview of the wars, a uniform guide, and descriptions of the weapons, strategy and tactics of the period. A set of simple miniatures rules are included which covers both the English Civil War and the tercios used in the wars earlier in the century. The majority of the book is a set of scenarios from the English Civil Wars (including a solo scenario of Preston), plus the battle of Lutzen from the 30 Years War. A basic campaign system is included. In addition, there are rules for integrating with the board game "The King's War" from Clash of Arms.

Scenarios Included:
Edgehill
Cropredy Bridge
Marston Moor
Naseby
Tippermuir
Aberdeen
Preston (solo scenario)
Dunbar
Worchester
Lutzen

24032.name: Ortho
24032.description:
From the Pennsylvania Packet, March 1, 1783:

"The subscribers beg leave to offer to the Public, a new invented GAME at CARDS, called ORTHO, designed not only for amusement, but instruction in the orthography of the English language ; instead of the four suits, or pips, in common use, these cards are furnished with four sets of the English alphabet, having such certain powers assigned to the respective letters as to admit of variety, ingenuity, and entertainment in the play, with the additional and important advantage of insinuating a correctness in spelling, and a knowledge in the operation of letters in the formation of words. These Cards, neatly ornamented and made up in packs of 104 cards each, with full Directions how they are to be played, printed on the wrapper, are made and sold by the subscribers, at their Card and Paper-Hanging Factory, in Walnut street, above the New Gaol, Philadelphia, and may be had at most of the shops. Price, but the single pack, 7s 6d, with a large allowance to purchase by the dozen.

EDWARD RYVES & CO.

N.B. The above CARDS are likewise Sold by the Printer hereof."

Glossary of terms --
orthography - the art of writing words with the proper letters according to standard usage
gaol - chiefly British variant of jail

24033.name: Survival
24033.description:
An official Scout endorsed game.

From the box:

The lives of nine people are in your hands. Do you have the resourcefulness, the ability to remain calm and take swift, effective action in the face of a crisis?

Find out how many of the nine would survive if you were their guide in a battle of wits, through five action packed zones: jungle, desert, marine, arctic and disaster.
Some challenges will ask for a verbal solution - others will ask you to demonstrate with actions.
It's exhilarating, it's fun, it's adventure. Best of all it's informative, because it pits you against real life obstacles.
Learn it, love it...one day you may have to live it.

24034.name: Plus 'n' Minus Games
24034.description:
From the box:

Each player draws a card from the stockpile, each card will show a maths question. That player reads the card and gives the answer. If the other player agrees with that answer, the player moves to the appropriate number square, ie. if the player draws the card 6 - 3, and correctly answers 3, the marker will be moved to the next 3 on the board.

24036.name: Merchant Prince
24036.description:
Merchant Prince is a fairly simple Monpoly-inspired game - players purchase control of commodities and areas of the world and charge other players for landing on them, with the aim of bankrupting them.

The basic game system is fairly novel. There is a map of the world on which players move ships from port to port (along a track), and a standard track running around the outside of the board on which players move ambassador pieces. On a turn a player rolls the die twice and must use one roll for each piece. Control of commodities is purchased on outer track spaces, but your ship has to be at an appropriate port to do so, establishing a relation between the pieces. Other spaces on the outer track reward or punish players controlling various commodities, and there are also spaces which allow one to become a Merchant Prince controlling one of the six regions of the world (and charge additional "rent" to players).

Another interesting bit is that the game is nominally set in the 25th century, which is used to justify dividing the world into six regions rather than the nations of 1937.

24037.description:
An island made up of 37 hex-shaped plastic tiles is slowly sinking into the ocean (as the tiles are removed from the board). Each player controls 12 Atlantean Tribesmen that they try and move towards the safety of the surrounding islands before the main island sinks. Players can either swim, latch onto a dolphin, or use boats to travel but must avoid sea monsters, octopuses, and sharks on their way to safety.

Escape from Atlantis is similar to the Parker Brothers game Survive! but with some key differences (e.g., people pawns are not worth a variable number of points).

In 2010, a reworked version of Escape from Atlantis which combines the rules of the game along with the rules to Survive! was printed by Stronghold Games titled "Survive: Escape from Atlantis!"
24037.name: Escape from Atlantis

24038.name: Oh-Bleep
24038.description:
You must attempt to get the 10 point-cards which must be traded for 1 chip. The first player to get 10 chips wins. You can draw as many cards as you wish one at a time, but if you get an OH-BLEEP card, you have to return all point-cards gotten in that turn.

Use your intuition to decide when to stop drawing cards before it's too late. The tension mounts with each new card drawn.

Contains a deck of 96 playing cards and 50 molded plastic chips.

24039.name: Gretrix
24039.description:
Variation in Kalah. Users sow a pocket around, then drop piece in final space, putting one of the pieces up in an unoccupied corner. Once all the corners are filled, ALL the pieces in that pocket are removed from the board and scored. Board gradually gets smaller and smaller.

The game was found here: http://www.abstractstrategy.com/gretrix.html

24041.name: Hummelchen
24041.description:
Players roll the dice and try to move their bumble bees to the blossoms of the tree shown on the game board.
When a bumble bee reaches a blossom it is safe. If another bumble bee reaches its space it is removed from the game.
Every player has 20 bumble bees and tries to occupy as many blossoms as possible.

24042.description:
"La Caída del Imperio Romano" (The Fall of the Roman Empire) is a strategic simulation of the events and conflicts that led the Romans to subdue the neighbor civilizations and create a vast empire throughout Europe, Africa and Asia Minor.

Two different games may be played:
- an 8-turns basic game focusing on the Punic wars.
- a 20-turns advanced game covering the 7-centuries period that saw the rise and fall of Rome.

The game is played by 2-4 players. Whenever 4 players are involved, two of them control the Western and Eastern Roman Empire, respectively, whereas the third plays the role of Carthage and the last player controls the Greeks, Egyptians, Persians, Barbarians and other minor people.

Players move their troops (hex-based), resolve combats, build and fortify cities, and either negotiate or conquer the weakest neighbor.

Any player getting the surrender or complete annihilation of enemies’ forces is considered the winner of the game. The Roman player wins whether he keeps 30 cities, at any time, or at least 20 cities at the end of the 20th turn. Otherwise, the winners are the Carthaginians or even these along with the Barbarian people.

Game components:
- One 80x64 cm map covering the Mediterranean basin, North Africa and Asia Minor
- 480 counters (armies and leaders, ships, cities, fortified cities, Barbarian invaders, etc.)
- A 15-pages rulebook
- One die
24042.name: La Caída del Imperio Romano

24043.name: Flying High: Around the World In 80 Plays
24043.description:
The game bills itself as the "high-adventure travel game that entertains and educates." One person acts as "Flight Director" and from two to six players have fun while learning about the world and its peoples, by answering geography and general knowledge questions.

Contents:
-One game board
-$60,000 travel dollars (in denominations of $100, $500 and $1000)
-One set of Flight Instructions and one Flight Director Quick-Reference Guide
-One owner's certificate with mail-in card
-Two dice and six miniature planes
-14 Fun-Island Cards
-50 Surprise Cards
-Two sets of 45 Geo-Quiz Cards & 15 Mystery-Quiz Cards (Level I and Level II)
-Plus Bonus: Rand McNally World Maps & Flags Reference Map

Object:
To fly from the City of Departure to the Winners' Circle/Home as quickly as possible while earning and winning as many Travel Dollars as you can. The champion is the player who finishes in the Winners' Circle/Home with the most travel dollars/

24044.description:
Children's Game in which the players represent dogs that need to cross 2 rivers (with wooden bridges) to retrieve a bone that they must return to the correct doghouse. That is a risky matter because each dog tries to push the others into the water. The dogs must also pick up and return a bone to their friend while finding the friend's proper hat. Whoever returns first wins the game.

Beautiful components with "playmobil" like dogs and and bones and with 4 wooden bridges.
24044.name: Fikkie en Zijn Vrienden

24045.name: The Armies of Tekumel, Volume I: Tsolyanu
24045.description: This 24-page booklet is a supplement that can be used with either the "Missúm!" or "Qadardalikoi" rules for 1:100 figure scale 25mm miniatures battles set on the fantasy world of Tekumel (the setting for the original "Empire of the Petal Throne" role playing game and the more recently published "Tekumel: World of the Petal Throne"). This volume contains statistics for the roughly 80 legions of the Empire of Tsolyanu and a miniatures painting guide.

24046.name: The Armies of Tekumel, Volume II: Yan Kor and Allies
24046.description: This 24-page booklet is a supplement that can be used with either the "Missúm!" or "Qadardalikoi" rules for 1:100 figure scale 25mm miniatures battles set on the fantasy world of Tekumel (the setting for the original "Empire of the Petal Throne" role playing game and the more recently published "Tekumel: World of the Petal Throne"). This volume contains statistics and a painting guide for the legions of the northern nation of Yan Kor and its allies: Saa Allaqiya, Milumanaya, Chayakku, Pijena, and Ghaton. This also includes a description of the Ghatoni forces of trained Serudla.

24047.name: The Armies of Tekumel, Volume III: Mu'ugalavya
24047.description: This 24-page booklet is a supplement that can be used with either the "Missúm!" or "Qadardalikoi" rules for 1:100 figure scale 25mm miniatures battles set on the fantasy world of Tekumel (the setting for the original "Empire of the Petal Throne" role playing game and the more recently published "Tekumel: World of the Petal Throne"). This volume contains statistics for the legions of the four palaces of Mu'ugalavya including the semi nomadic "Dune Leapers," the barbarian N'luss, and the executioner Legion of the Mourners in Sable. Reprinted in a more legible edition in 1997 by Tita's House of Games.

24048.name: The Armies of Tekumel, Volume IV: Salarvya
24048.description: This 24-page booklet is a supplement that can be used with either the "Missúm!" or "Qadardalikoi" rules for 1:100 figure scale 25mm miniatures battles set on the fantasy world of Tekumel (the setting for the original "Empire of the Petal Throne" role playing game and the more recently published "Tekumel: World of the Petal Throne"). This volume contains statistics and a painting guide for the legions of Salarvya and Pechano. Reprinted in a more legible version in 1997 by Tita's House of Games.

24049.name: The Armies of Tekumel, Volume V: Livyanu and Tsolei
24049.description: This 36-page booklet is a supplement that can be used with either the "Missúm!" or "Qadardalikoi" rules for 1:100 figure scale 25mm miniatures battles set on the fantasy world of Tekumel (the setting for the original "Empire of the Petal Throne" role playing game and the more recently published "Tekumel: World of the Petal Throne"). This volume contains statistics and a painting guide for the legions of ancient Livyanu and the isles of tsolei. (Note: This booklet describes the Livyani army before the later great plague.) Reprinted in 1997 in a more legible edition by Tita's House of Games.

24050.name: The Armies of Tekumel, Volume VI: Shenyu
24050.description: This 40-page booklet is a supplement that can be used with either the "Missúm!" or "Qadardalikoi" rules for 1:100 figure scale 25mm miniatures battles set on the fantasy world of Tekumel (the setting for the original "Empire of the Petal Throne" role playing game and the more recently published "Tekumel: World of the Petal Throne"). This volume contains statistics and a painting guide for the legions of the non-human Shen states as well as a reprint of Professor Barker's "Splendor of Shenyu" article.

24051.description:
Each player uses their fox to capture some of each of the types of fowl (chickens, ducks, geese and turkey) that are found in the farmyard. Players gain points for the fowl they have captured and also for saving from capture those fowl that share one or more of the same characteristics as their chosen target card.

Each round every player chooses to play one of their three fowl cards to determine turn order and which of the fowl counters a player can move. Players may move up to three fowl counters a combined total of up to three spaces on the hex shaped board. Players will choose whether to assist their own fox in capturing the fowl, or whether to save their secret target fowl and similar fowl from being caught by the other players’ foxes. Foxes then move up to two spaces in an attempt to capture one of the fowl. Moving the foxes through the foxholes will speed their progress and allow the foxes to creep up on the fowl unnoticed.

The game usually finishes when eight or fewer fowl remain at the end of a round. The target cards are then revealed, the points tallied (the most difficult part of the game) and a winner declared.
24051.name: Fowl Play!

24052.name: Staffa
24052.description:
Each year the different life forms on the planet Staffa compete in their traditional game of Hex Rock Climbing. The first team to have three members reach the Transmat station at the top of the Great Hex Rock is the winner.

The game consists of a game board, the Transmat station, 6 teams of 4 unique Staffans, 100 small rock pieces and 2 dice. The two dice are rolled and allocated between Staffan movement and the introduction or movement of the hex rocks. Rock placement is subject to certain rules and cannot be placed on top of Staffans! Staffan movement is across hexes or up or down. When a Staffan reaches the Transmat, the next player relocates the station.

There are variants for impatient people, athletes, architects and hamsters!

24053.name: Section X
24053.description:
The most notorious prisoners are kept isolated from the outside world on a heavily guarded island in the Atlantic Ocean, just off the coast of the United States. Those sentenced to life are kept in the most secure part of the prison: Section X. It is extremely difficult to escape from that part of the prison, but the prisoners have a plan. Will they succeed or are the strict guards too clever for them?

Strategic escaping game
SECTION X is a game in which clever escapees dig tunnels themselves but also make use of tunnels belonging to other players and cut each other off. Special hiding places ensure that the prisoners are safe when the ruthless prison guards make their rounds. A rumor has spread that an escape is imminent, so it becomes more and more difficult to remain out of the hands of the guards. Doors lock the entrances to the different escape tunnels. Are you able to control the underground network of tunnels and lead the prisoners from your cell block to freedom first? But watch out! The prisoners risk their lives if the escape is discovered!

Additional information
Age: 10 and up
Graphics: Yvon-Cheryl Scholten
Illustrations cover: Bernhard Kilchmann
Release Date: September 16th 2006

24054.name: Wheel 'N Deal
24054.description:
Each Player Owns a Casino! And what a choice of casinos: Wilbur Clark's Desert Inn; New Frontier; Sahara; El Rancho Vegas; The Thunderbird; or the Showboat. The big names of the 1950's, now, mostly history.
Game comes with six of the aforementioned casino placards to place in front of you when you play "the house", a miniature roulette wheel, a roulette board and a craps board, regular dice and, the main game mechanic, one die with the names of the six casinos and one die with the games poker, 21, roulette and craps on four sides and "Dealers choice" printed on the other two.
When the special dice are rolled, it determines who will be "the house" and the game to be played. The other players will play three games as customers in the host casino before the special dice are rolled to determine where the party will move next.
Play continues till all the money is in one casino's vault or until an agreed upon time.

24055.name: Be a Texas Millionaire
24055.description:
Spin to move your oil derrick through a labyrinth in the shape of the lone star state with side trips into Mexico, California, Indian Territory, Oklahoma, "Yankeeland", and Louisiana. Make (or spend) a fortune depending on the spaces that you land on along the way.
A cute game mechanic is the spinner which has inner and outer dials. The inner dial is used for moving 1-8 spaces, while the outer dial can be used when landing on certain "long shot" spaces. But beware, there are some dire consequences for an unlucky spin.

24057.name: South Park Trivia Game
24057.description:
How much do you know about South Park?
This is your chance to show the world, or at least your friends, how much you know about the insane inhabitants of the quiet mountain town of South Park. What does Cartman buy with the $1 Million Dollars he inherits from his dead Grandmother? (An amusement park). What phrase is written on Officer Barbrady’s Police Car? (To Patronize and Annoy).


All your favorite characters are here, from Chef and Butters to Timmy and Towlie. For 2 or More Players, Ages 18 and Up.

24058.name: Snap Election!
24058.description:
This is an electioneering game.

A Snap Election has been called and you are a candidate.
To get elected you need to win the votes of half the electorate. This means canvassing 6 groups of voters on 6 separate policies. It also means outsmarting your opponents, who may be out to win at any cost.
This is politics , remember, the playground of sleaze and the graveyard of principles. We are about to find out what kind of politician you really are!

24060.name: Warzone: A Modern Day Chess Game
24060.description: The game is played on a 20x20 grid superimposed on a map. The map’s terrain consists of various lakes, flatlands, caverns and mountains. Each player controls an army that consists of a variety of modern units depending on the scenario. Players set up their units any way they choose in their designed corner of the gameboard. A player may take four actions each turn but no piece may take more than two actions during a turn. Move, fire, rapid transit (move a piece in one’s own corner without using the dice), place a jet or pass are the possible actions. Units within range of each other undertake combat by rolling the appropriate six-sided or eight-sided die. The victory conditions are dependent upon the scenario.

24061.name: Megaquiz
24061.description:
Megaquiz is a Trivial Pursuit clone for 2-4 players. If there are more than 4 players, groups can be formed.

By answering questions from 3 periods (65-75, 75-85 and 85-95) the players gain points. He who reaches the finish first is the winner.

24063.name: Star-Struck
24063.description:
An acting game, in which you play a star in 1 of 5 entertainment categories (commercials, TV, music, theater, and movies). Your teammates have 2 minutes to guess your identity and situation.

You can talk, sing, dance, or use an actor's famous lines to get your identity across. The winning team is the first to successfully audition around the board in all 5 casting studios.

Includes gameboard, question cards, timer, 4 playing pieces, 1 6-sided die, and instructions

24064.name: Stampede!!!
24064.description:
Oh, no! The barnyard critters have gotten loose! And it's your job to round them up. The objective of the game is to 'round up' the most points worth of critters, which consist of different barnyard animals that vary in point value.
However, the critters move on their own; so you have to direct them to your corral with fences or surround the critter out in the field with fences.
Fences are played by laying down a fence card and placing fences on the 'Ranch' grid. The fence cards have different patterns on them, which limit how fences can be played.
Each player also has one 'Stampede!!!' tile that can be used to cause every critter on the board to move at once and possibly escape. Beware! There are Stampede!!! tiles mixed in with the critters, as well...
Once every critter is either caught or escapes, the game ends and the person with the most points wins.

24065.description: Napoleon's Russian Campaign is part of a trilogy that includes Napoleon's Italian Campaigns and Napoleon's Peninsula Campaign. The games can be played separately, or combined with some expansion modules to simulate the Napoleonic Wars.
24065.name: Napoleon's Russian Campaign

24066.description:
Hit The Road!

They're small but deadly! A dozen hot new Division 5 cars with counters for regular and variant versions, plus their dropped weapons and scenarios to use them. This book includes two different counters for each car - 24 in all - plus obstacles and other bonuses.

This is a supplement. You need at least one Car Wars Starter Set to play.

Part of the Car Wars Series.

Expands:

Car Wars
Car Wars (fifth edition)
24066.name: Car Wars Supplement, Division 5 Vehicle Guide

24067.name: Dragonology: The Game
24067.description: Who will be the Master Dragonologist? Based on the NY Times best-selling title, Dragonology, players will travel the world by air, land and sea, gathering knowledge of nine different species of dragons, using ancient spells and dragon charms in their pursuit. With the same authentic look and feel as the book, the game includes a map game board, exquisitely detailed 3-dimensional sculpted dragon and dragonologist pieces and much more.

boardgamehonor.19191: 2006 Japan Boardgame Prize Best Japanese Game Nominee

24068.description:
Shadow Hunters is a survival board game set in a devil-filled forest in which three groups of characters—the Shadows, creatures of the night; the Hunters, humans who try to destroy supernatural creatures; and the Neutrals, civilians caught in the middle of this ancient battle—struggle against each other to survive.

You belong to one of these groups and must conceal your identity from others since you don't know whom you can trust—at least not initially. Over time, though, someone might decipher who you are through your actions or through Hermit cards, or you might even reveal yourself to use your special ability.

The key to victory is to identify your allies and enemies early because once your identity is revealed, your enemies will attack with impunity using their special abilities like Demolish, Teleport, and Suck Blood or their equipment cards such as the Rusty Broad Ax or Fortune Brooch. This ancient battle comes to a head and only one group will stand victorious—or a civilian, in the right circumstances, might claim victory.

The 2011 edition of Shadow Hunters from Z-Man Games includes the Shadow Hunters Expansion, a set of ten new characters previously sold separately.
24068.name: Shadow Hunters

boardgamehonor.18927: 2008 JoTa Best Game Released in Brazil Nominee

24069.description:
The objective of the game is to score points by conquering territories with different values and types of resources.

The game has three turns and each one has three phases. In the first phase players place their armies on the board, relating to the types of resource cards that they have. In the second phase everyone scores by counting the regions values that they have settled in. In the third phase players battle in regions that are occupied by different armies. The winner of the battle can banish the armies of the other player to an adjacent area. After each player has battled once there is another scoring relating to the territories conquered through battles.

After three turns the player with the highest score wins.
24069.name: Jogo dos Conquistadores

boardgameimplementation.5699: Afrika: The Northern African Campaign, 1940-1942 (1st edition)

boardgamehonor.21307: 2006 Charles S. Roberts Best World War II Boardgame Nominee

24070.description:
Afrika II is a fast-paced game of mobile warfare at the operational level, covering the campaign in North Africa from 1940 until 1942. The heart of the game is the supply system, which highlights the logistical aspect of desert warfare.

Afrika II is a reprint of Afrika: The Northern African Campaign, 1940-1942 (1st edition), the second game in the award wining Standard Combat Series (SCS). Designed to provide players with a low complexity game system that also provides great historical detail and a touch of realism, the SCS is an ideal choice for gamers of all ability levels.

Game Scale:
Game Turn: 1 month
Hex: 10 miles / 16 Km
Units: Battalion to Division

Game Inventory:
One 22 x 34" map
One 22 x 17" map
One dual-side printed countersheet (280 1/2" counters)
One 8-page SCS rules booklet
One 16-page Afrika II game rules booklet

Players: 2 (suitable for solitaire play)
Playing Time: 3+ hours
Complexity: Low
Solitaire Suitability: High
24070.name: Afrika (second edition)

24071.name: Voyagers
24071.description: Voyagers is a trivia game based on regions of the world. There are five groups of 80 cards each - North America, South America, Africa & Oceania, Asia, and Europe. Each card has three questions on it - for People, Places, and Things. You choose which region to start in. Once you have answered a question in each of the three categories (People, Places, Things), you can move on to another region. Each correct answer allows you to continue your turn. Once you miss, play passes to the player/team to your left. The first player or team to answer each category in all five regions wins. It's listed for ages 10 to adult.

24072.description:
The second Chronopia supplement, the Sons of Kronos describes the tribes of firstborns who are not ruled by the One King, and the attempt of the Devout to conquer their lands.

the 96 pages rulebook features:
- detailed background about the Sons of Kronos and their country;
- new rules for war chariots, climbing and falling, fighting in the Wild Lands;
- army lists for the three Sons of Kronos tribes.

Expands:

Chronopia
24072.name: Chronopia: Sons of Kronos

24073.description:
Land of two rivers is the first Chronopia game supplement. It describes the return of the Stygian, an ancient race of serpent-men who ruled Chronopia millenias ago.

The 96 pages rulebook features:
- detailed description of the Stygian awakening, their society and how the other races try to deal with this new threat;
- Stygian army list;
- new units for all other races, most of them suited for desert fighting;
- some new rules and spells.

Expands:

Chronopia
24073.name: Chronopia: Land of Two Rivers

24074.name: Where's My Bone?
24074.description:
From the box:
A game for 2-4 players, aged 5 years and over.
These little dogs have hidden their bones and don't know where they are. Let us join in the search for them. The first one to find his 6 bones is the winner.

24075.name: Face Off!
24075.description:
Effectively, a version of pit where the players call for cards using specific sounds instead of numbers.

You are on a wild adventure in a far-away land, trading gems with strange and exotic natives. The scene is frantic! All around you, people are clucking like chickens, oinking like pigs, bulging their eyes, sticking out their tongues. They're using wild native signals to bargain for rubes, jade, emeralds, pearls... nowits time for you to join the action. Get read for some fast and frantic fun! Its Face Off!

Everyone is trading gem-cards fast! Be first to collect all nine cards of a single gem and you'll win the riches!

Quick, how many cards do you need for a complete set? Use the wild Trading Signals to let your opponent know!

Need one card? Then cluck like a chicken! Need two cards? Oink like a pig! Need three cards? "Baaaa-baaaa" like a lamb! Need four cards? "Gobble" like a turkey!

Trade cards with anyone who signals the same number back to you. Everyone keeps trading cards, fast, 'til someone has all nine cards of a single gem. It's a frantic race to the finish!

24076.name: Panasonic European Open Golf
24076.description:
Played over 18 scale plans of the famous Sunningdale course, this golf simulation allows Stroke play or Match play.

Unlike normal golf sims where a square grid is superimposed over a map, this game involves a clear plastic cursor to be targeted and positioned anywhere. Club accuracy and resulting ball position is assessed by card draw and ball position is plotted with a fine pen (wipes clear).

In this way infinite possibilities can result in what must be the most realistic golf themed board game developed.

24077.name: Group Photo
24077.description:
Group Photo is a simple children's card game in which players take turns drawing and discarding cards in an attempt to be the first player to match the picture cards in their hand, including at least two Photo ID cards, to the characters on their Group Photo card. The first player to do so wins the game.

In addition to the regular picture and Photo ID cards which comprise most of the deck, the game contains special purpose cards that function as wild cards ("Camera Shy" and "Say Cheese"), allow a player to skip another player's turn or retrieve one card from the discard pile in exchange for one from their hand ("Redeye"), or cause an opponent to swap their group Photo card for a new one ("Overexposed"). The game also includes rules for scoring multi-round play.

24078.description:
From the publisher:

Covering the great battles of Erwin Rommel from 1941 to 1943, as he fought his way back and forth across the deserts of North Africa. LNA uses cards to represent the military units, supply convoys and objectives of the historic campaign. To win, you must consider your units' combat power and maneuver options as well as their supply situation. The game features: the Afrika Korps, Tobruk, the Desert Rats, Malta, anti-tank guns, resupply from Europe, minefields and more. LNA is based around a new combat system that makes maneuver and planning as important as brute force. That approach is faithful to the historic events, in which smaller forces were often able to defeat and rout larger ones by using better tactics and planning. In LNA, battles can be won not only by overwhelming the enemy with firepower, but also by out-thinking and bluffing him. The dynamic game system puts you in charge of one of the most famous theaters of WWII.

Lightning Game Series
24078.name: Lightning: North Africa

24079.description:
Katoi or since 2006 Katoiz consists of a 6x6 board build up with tiles. These tiles have 3 characteristics: form (square, triangle or circle), color (blue, red, green, yellow or white) and size (big or small). In the base game you try to make a stack of tiles. To move the tiles around you can move a tile horizontally of vertically if 1 characteristic with the adjacent tile corresponds. To move diagonally, 2 characteristics have to correspond.

The rules included with the game have all kinds of variants which mean you can start playing the game with kids 3 years old. You can build up to the full game in several easy to manage steps.
24079.name: Katoiz

24080.name: Os Quatro Elementos
24080.description: In this game wizards battle against each other in an arena. The player moves his wizard one space and place a block in any other space of the 10x10 board. The player who isn't able to move his wizard in his turn is out of the game. Each player has three magic spell cards that can help his wizard's movement.

24081.name: Bushido: A Batalha de Sekigahara
24081.description: The game simulates the Sekigahara battle occurred in Japan in 1600. Two sides with six armies and one leader each confront themselves in a board with hexagonal spaces. An army moves one space with a directional area card and if it encounters another army they battle with battle cards (ATTACK, DEFENSE and COUNTER-ATTACK). The first player that kills the opponent's leader wins.

24082.name: Voltage
24082.description:
Simple 2-player card game. The board has 4 colored areas with plastic terminals on it. The terminals are 2 sided, either plus or minus. Players play color specific cards to their corresponding terminals, on either their side or their opponent's side of the board.

Players can do 1 of 3 things on their turn:

Play a card and draw a card (in that order)
Play 2 cards to 2 different colors
Draw 2 cards

When a colored terminal has a total of 5 cards played to it, that terminal is scored depending on the orientation of the terminal. If the terminal is plus side up, then the player with the highest numerical value wins the point. If the terminal is minus side up, then the player with the lowest numerical value wins the point. First player to score 4 points wins!

From the back of the box:

Within the crumbling walls of a forgotten power plant, ancient turbines continue to spin out their high voltage current. Your job as engineer is to make sure the power gets where it needs to go - but that won't be easy. A rival engineer is tinkering with the circuits and breakers as well, trying to funnel that juice in different directions. You'll need skill and a little bit of luck to keep the power flowing your way, but if you play your cards right, you'll have a bright future while you leave your adversary sitting in the dark.

24083.description:
Intermediate card drafting, tile laying game.

Players can do 1 of 2 things on their turn:

1 - Roll for Additional Resources

or

2 - Build Tents

Tents cost a specific 3-card building cost and once played, produce 1 resource type. Players must pay the exact resources to buy a tile. Once bought, the tile may be placed anywhere on the board. If a tile is placed adjacent to no other tiles, it scores 2 points immediately. If a tile is placed adjacent to another tile, it may use the resource that the already placed tile produces to reduce its building cost.

An encampment of tents can contain no more than 7 tent tiles. Once an encampment has 7 tent tiles in it, it is scored. Players score 1 point for every tent tile they built in the encampment. The player who played the 7th tile to close the encampment scores an addition point as a closing bonus.

Play continues until there are no legal places to play tiles. Player with the most points wins.

From the back of the box:

In the blistering heart of the desert, a caravan route winds its way through a lush oasis. The steady stream of travelers and pilgrims who cross the simmering dunes to this place are in desperate need of goods and supplies.

As an enterprising merchant, you plan to meet the demand.

Set up shop by building encampments, stitching them together from various merchant tents. Peddle camels, water, and other resources to expand your trade. The player who takes control of the most encampments gains control of the entire Desert Bazaar... and wins the game.
24083.name: Desert Bazaar

24084.description:
This expansion to the Polynesian-themed Kaivai includes four new types of huts and one new action:


The Pearl Divers Hut produces shells from fishing.
The Celebration Hut, when built, initiates a celebration on its island.
The Chief Hut gives a counter used to affect bidding costs and which can be used as influence during the end-game.
The Kava-Brewer Hut produces Kava, which can be changed into influence using the new action The Kava Ceremony.
24084.name: Kaivai Expansion

5614.name: CCP Games / CCP hf (Crowd Control Productions)

24085.description:
EVE: The Second Genesis™ is a collectible card game created by the developers of the award winning MMOG EVE Online.

Introduction & Background

The world of EVE is the world of the future - our future! As the game begins, mankind has spent millennia enduring a vicious cycle of destruction and triumph. It has led to millions of settlers being severed from civilization and
stranded in a galaxy, far away from planet Earth. Its history now faded in the mists of time. In this new world, five distinct human races have emerged as the primary contestants for power. They are the Amarr, Minmatar, Gallente, Caldari - all of which are playable in this Core Set - and the mysterious Jovians.

Each race relies on the success of progressive corporations to increase the overall influence in the galaxy. A corporation’s innate zest for building wealth and prestige, in addition to its intense focus on reaching goals, make the corporation the most effective tool in the struggle for power. Some would even say they are the most effective means of governing the masses as well...

The Game Concept

You must produce a steady income by claiming the outer regions of space and harvesting their rich resources. Enhance your star base and defend it from incoming threats. Build a fleet of spaceships and send them on missions to reduce your opponents’ income, steal their resources, and ultimately destroy their star bases.

Victory Conditions

If all your opponents’ star bases have been destroyed, or you have met an alternative victory condition, you win the game. If you are to draw a card when none are left in your deck, you lose the game.
24085.name: EVE: The Second Genesis

24086.name: American Girl 300 Wishes Game
24086.description:
The object is to match wishes with the player who would find them most desirable.

Players are dealt "wish" cards which describe personal accomplishments, careers or fun experiences. Each player then anonymously gives one or two wish cards (depending on # of players) to each of the other players by sliding them into their wish diaries. After wishes are passed out, each player examines the wishes they have received and ranks them from least to most desirable. Finally, everyone shares the wishes they received and how they ranked them (often good for a few laughs).

Originators of the wishes score points according to how they were ranked by the recipient. After three rounds, the player with the highest score wins.

24087.name: Badlands
24087.description:
Badlands of Orgoth - The land is newly discovered, Some say untamable, full of mystery and monsters. The land is also rich and the right person could their fame and fortune while adventuring here. The Land is called Orgoth, and it is awaiting its King!
You play a character who has come to Orgoth to seek fame and fortune. You may pick your character from one of five races (human, elf, dwarf, gnome, or feline)and three professions. (archer, mage, or warrior) each has its own strengths and weaknesses.

Game is best played with 1 - 3 players as the game time is generally 1 hour plus 1 hour per player.

1 - Board with Beginners version of Orgoth printed on it.
6 - 6 sided movement dice (2 green, 2 yellow, 2 Red)
3 – 10 sided dice
1 _ 6 sided die

24 Green Quest Cards
24 Yellow Quest Cards
24 Red Quest Cards
72 Green Encounter Cards
72 Yellow Encounter Cards
72 Red Encounter Cards
168 Item Cards
gems counters
health markers
3 dragon markers
3 traveler markers
15 unique character sheets
5 - player pawns

6 – City Walls
6 - Castles
6 - Temples
6 - Mage Towers
6 - Barracks
6 - Merchants
6 - Weapon Smiths
6 - Armorers

Players advance in level by traveling the realm, defeating the enemy creatures, and accepting quests. The farther from the main city players travel the harder the monsters and the quests become, but the rewards are also greater.
There is no set path to follow and only you as a player can direct where your character goes and what he does.

Travel out to the farthest reaches of the game board and build your castle - People will come to your area and as lord of your castle you can collect taxes, taxes help to build your city, and further your cause. Each city expansion you build gives a different bonus to your character and city.

Be careful not to venture too far into the wilds as you might just wake a Great Dragon who will not stop until you defeat it or it has destroyed every city on the board.

Play with or against your friends or even play alone, trade with your opponent any item he needs for one that suits you better, or purchase a curse scroll and use it to cause havoc with the player who are ahead of you.

Once you have completed all your required quests, built a complete city, and have attained level 10, you become the First King of Orgoth! Long live the King!

boardgamecompilation.169521: Commands & Colors: Ancients Expansions #2 and #3 – Rome vs the Barbarians; The Roman Civil Wars

24089.description:
Imperial Rome and The Barbarians is the second expansion to Commands & Colors: Ancients. In this second expansion you will find historical battles that focus on Rome and the early Gallic invasion, invasion of the Northmen, the Servile War (Spartacus), Caesar's conquest of Gaul, the Roman Civil Wars and much more.

Showcased in the second expansion, are over 20 scenarios that range from 390 BC (Allia River) to 9 AD (Teutoburger Wald), and all the blocks and labels you need to field the Roman and Barbarian forces to fight out these battles. By now, you know we can do this, because Commands & Colors: Ancients by design is a unique historical game system that allows players to effectively portray stylized Ancient battles that play to a conclusion in less than an hour.

Imperial Rome and The Barbarians will feature at least one new unit type as well as several "specialty" units and leaders (Briton Chariots, Legionaries using the pilum, and Caesar, for example). Each of these operates within the confines of the original system rules, with only slight modifications to reflect their historical abilities and importance. So, rules-wise, if you've played Commands & Colors: Ancients, you'll have no trouble at all learning the few special rules for these new types of units.

The battle dice resolve combat quickly and the Command cards provide an element of luck that creates a fog of war and presents players with both challenges and opportunities for victory. Yet the tactics you need to execute conform remarkably well to the advantages and limitations inherent to the various Ancient units, their weapons, terrain and the history.

Expands:

Commands & Colors: Ancients
24089.name: Commands & Colors: Ancients Expansion Pack #2 – Rome and the Barbarians

24090.name: Stratgol
24090.description:
Stratgol© has the objective of simulating the action of a real soccer match, allowing to recreate game situations with the same level of excitement of the real thing.

Dice play an important role, helping to work out issues when uncertainty must be present but not to the point of making it a chance game. The decisions of when and how to execute your movements and the administration of your tactical points will have a greater impact on the final result.

The rules were designed according to the FIFA rules. A full length game usually lasts 90 minutes. This is a game for two players, but rule expansions will be available in the future at: www.stratgol.com.

The game was released in June/2006, so far is only available in Spanish but an English version is expected in 2007.

24091.name: Bumpershot
24091.description:
From the box, "The game with a thousand ways to play the angles! Bounce your puck off the bumpers and into the scoring holes....or go for a reject and cancel your opponent's score!"

This is a dexterity game with a spring loaded launcher and rubber band bumpers all along the edges. It slightly resembles a game of shuffle board but you must bounce the puck off the walls as direct shots are blocked by the board.

24092.name: Tover je Toverweg
24092.description:
Translation from the website:

Every year the wizards compete to become the Masterwizard. This year the tournament is held in the forest of a thousand roads. There the wizards will have to prove themselves by bringing their new students to the magical destination. Do you dare taking on this challenge and play the game? Your students aren't allowed to use magic, so the result of the tournament is in your hands. By acquiring the right magic cards your students can travel quickly or your opponents students can be hindered.

By smartly and tactically using your magic powers, you can easily reach the destination. With Tover je Toverweg the takes the first steps in the magical world of boardgames. The structure and setup offer the right balance between options and ability for the youngest players. With 4 different game boards, accessories and extensive variants the game is a challenge for young as well as old (and even grown-ups). The game grows along with the development of the spacial view.

24093.name: Steps: Step by Step Game
24093.description: A game based around the UK pop group Steps. Players control one of the 5 members, and must go through a number of phases (steps), collecting tokens and money. Phases include spinning a spinner; answering questions on Steps; singing Steps lyrics and performing Steps dances,(with other players voting on performance). At the end of the game the player with the highest value of tokens has the highest chart hit and wins the game. In the event of a draw the one with the most money wins.

24094.name: Mighty Max Ultimate Adventure Game
24094.description: A 3-D board game where players join Mighty Max in a quest for 6 magical Doom stones. The game is played through 6 different Doom zones, all built within the six sides of a 3-D cone-shaped tower on a box base. Each zone has 2 playable level floors and all are based on popular Mighty Max toy play sets. The first player to collect all the 6 Doom stones from each zone is declared the winner of the game. The game is highly detailed and is played with cards and dice. Mighty Max - His Fate Is In Your Hands! For ages 3 and up.

24095.name: Mighty Max And The Crystal Quest
24095.description: Produced by Irwin Toy Limited and released in Canada, "Mighty Max And The Crystal Quest" is a pretty standard board game. Much like LIFE or MONOPOLY, you use Mighty Max character figures to move around the board while trying to land on certain squares. Instead of money or real estate, you're trying to gather "tokens" that grant various abilities. The first one to make it to Skull Mountain, grab the Crystal Of Souls, and make it back to school (where Mighty Max needs to get back to) wins. Throughout the board there are "Battle Arenas" where you must use your ability tokens to defeat the villain associated with each arena.

24096.name: Davy Crockett Indian Scouting Game
24096.description:
If Candy Land had a spinner instead of all those cards...

Spin the spinner, move ahead (or back) to the appropriately colored space on the trail. Some spaces have additional instructions such as "Fight a crocodile go back one space", "Grin down a bear, move to red".
The game board has a classic Disney feel to it. The artwork is very colorful with a lot of detail in the background behind the colored trail. This might keep the adults amused while the race to deliver the message to Army Headquarters keeps the 4 to 8 year old set entertained.

The game has a bit of an identity problem. The game box top names it as "Disneyland's Official Davy Crockett Indian Scouting Game", the box sides, "Walt Disney's Official Davy Crockett Indian Scouting Game", and the spinner card ,"Walt Disney's Davy Crockett's Indian Scout Game".

24097.name: Spider and the Fly
24097.description:
Spider and the Fly Whitman Publishing # 4720 "Another Whitman Fun-Planned Game"
Player 1 plays a spider with a trapping cup. Player 2 plays two flies. The Spider shakes the dice in the spider cup, turns cup upside down in the center of the web, and lifts the cup. If both dice are even numbers, he tries to trap the Fly on the right with the cup before the player controlling the fly can pull the fly off the board with its attached string. Odd numbers activate the leftmost fly. One even / one odd die ... free parking.
Comes with two flies on strings, two scoring pegs, two wooden dice and a small bowl with a spider molded onto it.

Bears some resemblance to the game Pounce!

24098.name: (There's a) Fly in My Soup
24098.description: Fast paced game of action and skill, where the goal is to be the first player to fill out your game card by "flicking" your flies into everyone else's soup. Outsmart the Crazy Chef while he attempts to block your flies with his ladle. Or aim for a bonus shot by flicking your flies into the Chef's soup!

24100.name: VooDoo Doll Game
24100.description:
"VOODOO Doll game for boys and girls"

"The mysterious VooDoo doll holds the key
that keeps the witch doctor from leaping free!"

Players take turns pushing pins into the plastic voodoo doll. If a player pushes the pin into the "wrong" booby-trapped hole, the witch doctor bursts out of his hut.

24101.name: Trailer
24101.description: Trailer is a quiz game about movies. Players are divided in four groups and have to reach the end of the board by drawing a card and answering the correct name of the movie that's written on it. It can be a comedy, a drama, an adventure, a classic or a thriller, depending of the area that the players are in the board. The less hints they use to guess the movie's name the more they're able to move.

24102.name: Action Stations
24102.description:
Action Stations is a World War I naval game, based on the MIGHTY HOOD/BATTLESHIPS AT WAR system. Includes the rulebook, reference cards, game markers, and 136 individually-rated color ship counters (on heavy stock) from British, German, French, Italian, Austrian navies. The standard game includes additional rules modules (and ships/counter) for merchants, armed merchants, and destroyers. The 76 merchants and destroyers are printed in black on color cardstock.

The rules are very similar to the MIGHTY HOOD/BATTLESHIPS AT WAR WW2 rules, with some modifications for WWI combat and formations. The several scenarios include Jutland.

This is a DTP game: you'll need to mount and cut apart the counters before play. Additional ships (Russians, more CL and B from the countries in the main rules) will be made available later.

24103.name: Astrobirdz
24103.description:
In the Astrobirdz card game, you decide how many tricks you can perform with the hand of cards you've been given. Each round your high cards equal fantastic sport board tricks you're trying to perform to gain all the trick cards for that round. Each turn you draw from one of the six foil BERZERKERBIRDZ cards and use their powers to help you win the contest.

This edition of the ASTROBIRDZ card game includes a full color deck of 54 cards, 6 foil BERZERKERBIRDZ cards, an ASTROBIRDZ fingerboard, a score pad, and a set of rules.

The Astrobirdz card game is a game of strategy and skill as you use the cards you've been dealt to perform as many tricks successfully as possible. The game is great fun for two to six players, ages 10 and up. Each game takes from 20-40 minutes depending on how many players there are in the game.

24104.name: Evolution
24104.description: Evolution is a card/tile laying race game , ideal for families but also suitable for young at heart players of all ages. Players must lay a path of eras (cards) in chronological order, outwards from their edge of the board. The objective is to be first to advance your playing piece onto the end era of your own path. Cards are drawn from a main pack which contains eras cards . Play actions are determined by what symbol shows when the die is thrown. The three symbols are era ( reveal an era) , thunderbolt ( take a thunderbolt card) and eruption ( move or or erupt volcanoes on an opponents path). Thunderbolt cards are not laid but trigger various natural calamity and more benign events. Each era card is an aerial view associated with a particular evolutionary period. Each era card has various sites to be negotiated including rocks,waterholes, swamps, volcanoes, rising seas and ravines. Different sites have different levels of risk (hazardous areas). Certain thunderbolts can penalize players whose paths have cards that contain hazardous areas. Players interact by contesting some or each era card by a bidding using tokens. A neat (new) rule limit player's from bidding excessively because tokens are lost by the winning bidder depending on the bid difference between his and the next highest bid. A player who wins an era card may be include it in any path. He may for example, include a card with a risky site in an opponent's path. Each player now has his own cone (volcano) which can be moved to create an obstacle for an opponent's playing piece and can cause an eruption on an opponent path. An eruption can be used to force an opponents playing piece back . The first player who survives his turn with his path complete ( 6 era cards ), holding at least one token and with his piece on his end ( sixth) era card wins the game.

24105.name: The Da Vinci Code Game
24105.description:
"Now you can live the adventure pf The Da Vinci Code. Play the game with the intrigue and excitement of the highly anticipated movie, The Da Vinci Code, based on the best-selling novel. Game uses trivia and word play to unlock ancient mysteries and modern secrets that will delight all adventure seekers."
-Game Box

24106.name: Ponents
24106.description: The object of the game is to be the first player to move all of your "Ponents" (game pieces) to the opposite side of the board. Pieces can move one space diagonally, staying on their color spaces, or can diagonally jump pieces of any color, but again must stay on their own color spaces. Includes rules for a points variant.

24107.name: Lucky Puppy Math
24107.description:
This game has a two sided board. On one side there is a version of Snakes and Ladders called Blue Ribbon Pooch in which players use dogs as tokens, and use two numerical dice and one operations dice to add or subtract before moving their token. Hence, players must perform the required mathematical operations in order to move their token.

On the other side of the board is Lucky Puppy, in which all players begin in the dog pound and work their way around the board to find a home. There are four special places on the board, where players may improve or hamper their progress by completing a task. When a player lands on one of these spaces, however, all players get a chance at receiving the bonus or penalty: they complete to answer the math question posed by the roll of the dice. A player must complete all the tasks to get a home. Dice are used in the same way as in Blue Ribbon Pooch. The graphics on the game board depict various situations in which a child might interact with a dog.

This is a children's game designed to develop math skills.

24108.name: Verkehrs-Quiz
24108.description:
You have 50 cards with traffic signs and 50 cards with their explanation (in Dutch, French, Italian and German). And you have 8 cards with a police-man on it.
Different ways of playing.
Somebody reads the card, the others try to find the matching sign as quick as possible.
Or you can deal the cards with signs. Somebody reads the cards aloud. You put the matching sign on it. If you're incorrect, you get a police-card.

24109.name: Monkey Auto Races
24109.description:
From the box top: "A hands & knees fast action game with mini head-sticks." Yes, that's right "mini head-sticks" not the large ones found in most other games.

This is a race game in which you push a small car around a course with the "mini head-stick" while on your hands and knees. The game includes 4 mini head sticks, 4 course markers, and 4 cars. The course markers can be set up in different track configurations.

I'm not sure where the monkeys fit into this.

24110.name: Teraforming
24110.description: Teraforming is a card game for 2-4 players (5 or more with extra decks) that is easy to play but tough to master. Players compete as they "teraform' a new planet by laying puzzle-like cards from their hands down on the table forming a gameboard. The person who forms the most landmasses and scores the most endgame points wins. The combinations are numerous, and the points are scarce. Do you have what it takes to make a planet?

24111.description:
KWAZOOLOO is a game of observation and speed. Roll the dice and match the pictures to the animals rings you are wearing on your fingers. At each turn, the action die shows what the players need to look for: the baby, the habitat or the favorite food of each animal. The fastest player removes a ring. The first player to have removed all their rings, wins!

Ages 5+
24111.name: Kwazooloo

24112.name: Invasores
24112.description: Each player has nine spaceships and one atomic-cannon. The objective of the game is to land all your spaceships in the enemy's planet, on the other side of the board. You move the spaceships by rolling the dice and if an enemy approaches your planet you can try to shoot him with the atomic-cannon.

24113.name: Climbing Everest
24113.description: Essentially a roll-and-move fest along the lines of snakes and ladders, players begin at base camp and advance to the top of everest with various aids or hindrances represented by special squares on the track.
