The full deployment of the Allied Sixth Army Group north of the Swiss border and the continued offensive stance of Patton’s Third Army press the Germans in Lorraine back towards the Rhine. At the same time, the Americans in the center take Aachen while the British attain the line of the Meuse.

Scenario 3: The Roer River and Lorraine
Nov. 12-Dec. 10, 1944 (5 turns)
Greatly recovered from its Normandy debacle, the German army by November 1944 is offering stiff resistance to the Allies. For their part, Allied armies attempt to clear the right bank of the Rhine in Lorraine, and to expand and secure their penetration of the Westwall at Aachen. This stage of the war sees some of the most bitter and bloody fighting in the Western Front.

Scenario 4: Herbstnebel-Nordwind: From the Bulge to Alsace.
Dec. 11, 1944-Feb. 2, 1945 (9 turns)
The Allied advance has been essentially brought to a halt before the Westwall. The German High Command made a conscious decision about their strategy for the next phase of the campaign. Adolf Hitler opts for a counter-offensive, and attacks are planned in the Ardennes and toward Strassbourg. The Germans throw their best forces into a last great gamble to snatch victory from the jaws of defeat.

Scenario 5: The Defense of the Rhine
Feb. 4-Apr. 3, 1945 (10 turns)
After the failure of the Bulge and Alsace offensives, an exhausted German army returns to the Westwall to discover that the Allies are already prepared for a bone-shattering frontal offensive. Allied troops grind through the Westwall defenses and the Germans attempt to hold the Rhine. Hitler, dissatisfied with the situation in the West, relieves his best commanders. With the end of the war nearing, an important question for the Allied Command is what kind of attack force should be brought to bear against Berlin.
24325.name: Toppling the Reich

24326.name: Kenshin vs Shingen: Battle of Kawanakajima
24326.description:
This game simulates the clash between Takeda Shingen and Uesugi Kenshin that took place near the Kawanakajima plains on September 10th, 1561 (1561 being Eiroku 4 in the calendar system of the time). This was the 4th, and greatest (yet still inconclusive) of the battles of Kawanakajima.

Many previous wargames use luck of the dice to determine the results of combat, but this game instead has players choose one of their combat cards, numbered 1-6, to resolve battles. Because of this, victory is determined not by the 'random factor' of one's luck with dice, but with 'reading and bluffing'.

24327.description:
This game covers Napoleon at Waterloo.

Many previous wargames use luck of the dice to determine the results of combat, but this game instead has players choose one of their combat cards, with modifiers equivalent to dice rolling, to resolve battles. Because of this, victory is determined not by the 'random factor' of one's luck with dice, but with 'reading and bluffing'.
24327.name: Hundred Days Campaign

24328.name: Die Nasionale Kruger-Wildtuin
24328.description: In Die Nasionale Kruger-Wildtuin (aka The Kruger National Park) players take a tour of the Kruger National Park in South Africa, where the object is take photographs of as many animals as possible before visiting your three campsites and exiting the park.

24329.name: Flits de Muis
24329.description:
A game where a player tries to get the wooden mouse as fast as possible to its destination in the food chips, while another player tries to solve the dexterity game. If the player gets the food before, he gets to keep it.

Fritz der Mäuseblitz is a game for children 6 to 12. There is a board with squares between the mouse hole and the pantry. Each round, a player plays the mouse and his/her left neighbor tries simultaneously to catch the mouse. After each turn, roles turn clockwise. The player with the mouse rolls a D6 die and moves the mouse from the hole to the pantry and back to get food. Simultaneously, the other player tries to put 2 mouses in 2 traps in a tiny dexterity game. If he succeeds before the mouse reaches the pantry, he gets 2 food cards (with a number value on it), if he succeeds while the mouse in on its way back to the hole, both players get a food card, and if the mouse reaches the hole, the "mouse player" gets 2 food cards. The winner is the player with the highest total on his/her food cards.

24330.name: Word In Progress
24330.description: Word in Progress is a sort of word game which turns the methodology of building complete words, as is found in word games such as Scrabble or Boggle, on its head. In Word in Progress, players must work together to build partial words without being the player to complete an actual word, all the while attempting to discard as many of their respective points (letters) as possible before being eliminated from the round of play.

468.name: The United States Playing Card Company

24331.description:
From the front cover text:

Complete rules for easy games that are fun to play for one or more players. Plus card tricks and beginners' Contract Bridge.
24331.name: 50 Card Games for Children

24332.description:
(From Games Workshop Website)


The Cities of Death expansion to Warhammer 40,000 (fourth edition) and Warhammer 40,000 (fifth edition) introduces rules that let you engage in bitter struggles amid the deadly city streets of the 41st millennium. Also included are modeling tips, painting secrets, scenarios and much, much more.*


Cities of Death gives the players the opportunity to play Skirmish style game play, similar to what Mordheim is to Warhammer Fantasy Battles. There is a new line of city ruin Terrain sold through Games Workshop for Cities of Death.

Requires Warhammer 40K or The Battle for Macragge to play.

Expands:

Warhammer 40,000 (fourth edition)
Warhammer 40,000: Battle for Macragge
Warhammer 40,000 (fifth edition)
24332.name: Warhammer 40,000 Cities of Death

24333.name: Knights of the Round Table

boardgamefamily.22839: The Legend of King Arthur and the Knights of the Round Table

24333.description:
A sort of a proto-RPG using miniatures, set in the world of "Le Morte d'Arthur," which can be used to fight stand-alone melees, or to play extended campaigns.

Included are:
-rules for 1 on 1 melees and jousts that involves choosing cards representing various attacks or defenses. Percentage dice are used to determine combat results, your chance to hit being determined by your and your opponent's choice of card. The severity of the result is determined by the amount which your roll exceeds the base chance to hit

-simplified rules for combats involving multiple combatants

-rules for limited campaigns(lasting a few hours) and for longer campaigns of perhaps indefinite length. The extended ("full") campaign includes rules for warfare and conquest and enable players to play enchanters as well as knights. There are encounter tables and many rules designed to capture the flavor of the Arthurian mythos.

24334.name: Jeux de pions pour aujourd'hui
24334.description:
Jeux de pions pour aujourd'hui is a set of laminated cardstock game boards, stickers for placing on pieces (not supplied, but easy to find or improvise), and an activity book containing historical flavor text in French and rules in both French and English, all packaged in a clear plastic pouch. The game boards, sticker sheets and rules included in the set are:

Agon / Queen's Guards
Le canard Marseillais / The Duck from Marseilles
Jeu de la chasse au loup / Wolf Hunt
Jeu des chasseurs / The Hunters
Le jeu du cirque / Circus
Jeu du Congo / Congo
Foot-ball lil-i-put / Lilliputian Soccer
Jeu des grenouilles / Frogs
Jeu des quatrarmes / Quaterarms
Salta / Salta
Le tacticien / The Tactician
Le voyage à Pékin / Trip to Beijing

Ce fichier contient différents types de documents.

Un livret de 42 pages donnant les règles des 12 jeux de pions, en français et en anglais, avec de nombreux diagrammes qui facilitent la compréhension. La première partie du livret situe ces jeux dans leur contexte historique et donne un aperçu du monde des jeux de pions en ce début de XXI siècle : centres de vacances collectives, à l'école, en famille.

Douze tabliers cartonnés correspondant à 12 jeux de pions édités en France, la plupart au début du XX, à la Belle Époque : l'Agon, Le canard Marseillais, Jeu de la chasse au loup, Jeu des chasseurs, Le jeu du cirque, Jeu du Congo, Foot-ball lil-i-put, Jeu des grenouilles, Jeu des quatrarmes, Salta, Le tacticien, Le voyage à Pékin.

Des planches de figurines autocollantes et prédécoupées : dé spécial, pions et cartes.

24335.name: Goola
24335.description:
Goola is a advanced adaptation of "Connect Four" with some twists. Players alternately drop one of their twenty "Goola" beads into one of the five slots in the Goola Tower trying to form a line of 4 or 5 beads of their color in order to accumulate points (1 point for a line of 4 and 2 points for a line of 5). The twist here is that scoring only happens after all the beads are placed. After the initial placement, each player then alternately operate one of the five mechanic valves at the bottom of the tower under each slot to make the beads drop one by one out the bottom of the tower. After each bead drops out, each player count all the points they get for forming lines of 4 or 5 beads of the same color. The player with the higher points scores the difference in points on the scoreboard. The first player to reach 8 points on the scoreboard wins. A further twist can be found in the blind-play option built in the Goola Tower. This advance play is similar to the basic game except that the bead placement is shielded from the players' sight, and the players must reply on memory to calculate where to place their beads. After all the beads are played, the lock mechanism is released allowing the beads to drop into sight and the game continues as normal.

Game components:
40 Goola beads in two colors
1 Goola tower
1 Tower base with scoreboard
2 Goola stickers
1 Rulebook

24336.name: Empire
24336.description:
H.G. Wells Awards for "Best All-Time Napoleonic Rules" and "Hall of Fame

Gold Hot-Stamped Imperial Green Leatherette 3-Ring Binder
Over 100 pages of rules and designer notes with numerous pages of reference material specifying leader ratings, troop-types, and much more.

Colorful die-cut counters for orders, unit status and terrain aids.

6 color-coded reference charts for easy access to important tables of play.

1 fold-out elan chart

24337.name: Memoir '44: Campaign Bag
24337.description:
A Carrying Case built to house the Memoir '44 base game along with all the expansions.

From the Official Website:

"The official Campaign Bag is the definitive storage and travel solution for the Memoir ‘44 Game System. It is specifically designed to accommodate even the most demanding Overlord player and will hold up to 2 complete copies of the board game, plus all current expansions; or a single copy of the game with all its expansions and more room to grow.

...

The Memoir ‘44 Campaign Bag also includes a large-scale bonus countryside map in the new BREAKTHROUGH format, plus on the reverse side, an exclusive ready-to-play battle map - Breakthrough to Gembloux!"

...

Part of the Memoir '44 series.

24338.name: ClimbingMan
24338.description:
Reach the top of the rock wall to complete this solitaire game, which uses a standard piecepack. In the game, you control the climber's hands and feet and also the position of the body in relation to the extremities. Find a way to move upwards choosing spots that are strong enough to support your weight.

The tiles make up the wall and the coins (suit up) the spots you can hold on to. 4 dice represent your 4 extremities and a pawn your "center of gravity". When you place an extremity in a spot you can hold on to, you flip the coin and it shows the maximum weight it can support. In addition, the farther an extremity is from the "center of gravity" the less weight it can support too. After moving the die to the new spot, you place it showing the weight it supports. The trick is to support your whole weight between the 4 extremities. Then, move your center of gravity to a new position where you can reach newer spots, finding your way through the wall.

24339.name: ABC Lotto
24339.description:
One child alone will enjoy playing the game as a puzzle by trying to match up the small cards with the pictures on the boards. This type of play will help develop one of the basic skills necessary in learning to read.

FOR GROUP PLAY... each child takes one of the boards. The small cards are mixed up thoroughly and placed face down in the middle of the table.

The child to the left of the one who mixed the cards is the first to go and picks any card in the pile. If the card matches a section of his board, he places it over the matching illustration and has the privilege of picking the next cards also. This same player continues to pick cards until he reaches on that does not match his board. If one of the other players needs this card, he calls for it and also continues to pick and match as did the previous player. If no one needs the card picked, it is turned face down again and the child to the left of the last player is the next to go.

The play continues around the group until one child has all the sections of his board covered with the matching cards and is declared the winner.

Before playing a new game the boards are interchanged among the players.

24340.name: Jubilee
24340.description:
A really quirky Red, White & Blue capture & replacement game (no points are scored) where the winner is the first player to have all his men in play on the board, however this is achieved.

In this game the player’s men are called Purim.

Once laid the Purim are neither ‘jumped’ or moved - but may be ‘returned to that player’s pot’. The key to this game is ‘Red, White, Blue. Red, White, Blue,,,etc’. Remember that & you cant go wrong. Recommended Ages 7+

24341.name: Troy
24341.description:
For 2 to 4 players played on the intersections of the board where the winner is the player with the most points at the end of the game.

In this game the players men are called Sheckles.

With all of the Sheckle belonging to all of the players you play with as many Sheckles as you like to make a set, then play with as many sets as you like to build your armies. Troy is played in ‘waves’, with points scored by catch-trapping Sheckles that are ‘in-play’ which, if not saved, make up that players next wave; So although saving is not obligatory you’ll soon regret it if you don't! Enjoy. Recommended Ages 9+

24342.name: Pedrek
24342.description:
The Cornish word for 'square', for 2 to many more players where the winner is the first player to complete a circuit of their score card, called their ‘Table card’.

In this game the players men are called Dan.

The sets themselves are made up of either:

a (A) set; Red, Yellow, Blue & Purple cards; Or

a (B) set; Black, White, Green & Brown cards.

Therefore with the adding together of further sets, e.g. 2 (A) sets, this would be a 2 to 4 player game with up to twenty-four Dan per player; or with the adding together of an (A) & a (B) set this would give a game for 2 to 8 players, with up to 12 Dan per player: Etc. There is no limit to how many sets can be added together to make a bigger and bigger game! Cracking. Recommended Ages 9+

24343.name: Gammot
24343.description:
My only variation game, this is a true 4 player Backgammon game, not a team game, but for 4 individual players. Not only is it a great game for those that already know backgammon but it also makes a great conversation piece set up on the coffee table.

There's a couple difference from the original in the set up rules and the throw rules; & there's also a nice little rule of my own thrown in that you might like to play. Recommended Ages 9+

24344.name: LEGO Bionicle: The Quest Game
24344.description:
The evil Piraka have invaded the island of Voya Nui and are now on the hunt for the powerful Mask of Life. Take up the Toa Inika mission to find the Mask before the Piraka. Traverse the island carefully, and be ready to do battle along the way.

Includes six exclusive collectible Toa Inika game pieces, a double-sided game board, a Protodermis ball launcher with Zamor sphere, a Piraka target, 50 Quest cards, and a die.

24345.name: Pictionary: Salem Holiday
24345.description:
This appears to be a game issued by R.J. Reynolds. The use of Salem Holiday Edition on the box indicates it was sold as a promotional item (I assume with Salem cigarettes).

It comes in a small box (approximately 5 by 7 inches). The following items are included:

- A small gameboard (6 by 9 inches). The gameboard folds out and inside the directions for play are printed. There are also a small number of paper sheets stapled on the interior gameboard.
- A small die
- 4 pawns
- 2 pencils
- A small pack of 20 cards.

24346.name: Gorram Reavers!
24346.description: Players are parts of Reaver packs from Joss Whedon's "Firefly" universe. The goal is to raid planets and moons for victims. Winner is the first player to a 1000 body count. The board is a variable lay out of planets and moons with chits on them representing populations to ravage. Players move their ships from location to location and trying to over power what they find. Players use cards to increase their crew "packs" and give them bonuses as well as cards that effect the 'verse and other players. Players can upgrade ships to carry bigger crews.

24347.name: Keep Flyin'
24347.description:
From the rules:
In Keep Flyin, you are the Captain of a Firefly class mid-bulk transport, trying to eke out a living by taking any jobs you can find, legit or not, do them, and get paid. All the while you will be avoiding the oppressive governing body known as the Alliance, the terrifying Reavers who seek to eat you, and various other local color in the ‘Verse. You will find jobs on planets and even in the deepest parts of the Black. So find a job, don’t care much what it is, and keep flyin’.

Players move from planet to planet looking for jobs and searching abandoned ships. Players then move potential enemy ships, (Alliance or Reavers) after opponent's ships. has mechanic for pursuit and battle is dice based. First player to raise enough money to retire wins.

Home Page: http://users.adelphia.net/~wydraz/firefly/keepflyin.html

24348.description:
A fan-made re-theme of BANG!, based on Joss Whedon's "Firefly" TV show. Instead of Sheriff, Deputy, Outlaw and Renegade, it's Captain, Crew, Local Color and The Merc. Characters are from the TV show, such as Wash, Mal, Book, Zoe, River, etc. Weapons and everything else is also based on the show; i.e. Vera (Weapon) and the Mule (Vehicle instead of Mount). And instead of Beer, you get Mudder's Milk.

Expanded by:


BWAH!: Gorram Plans
BWAH!: This Land
BWAH!: Local Color
BWAH! Can't Stop the Signal (Also plays as separate base game)
BWAH!: Those Left Behind


Currently Active Download Links:


http://www.fireflyfans.net/mthread.aspx?bid=13&;tid=36208&mid=664346#664346
http://jonathan.kc8onw.net/TCM%20Firefly%20Games/
24348.name: BWAH!

24349.name: Die vier Jahreszeiten
24349.description: "The Four Seasons" is a simple children's set-collection game. Twenty-eight wooden tiles with illustrations of scenes from the four seasons are arranged into a square of five on a side with the remaining tiles forming a pile in the center. Four "season children", each in a different color representing one of the seasons, are placed on the track. Players try to collect one card from each of the seasons by moving any one of the four children the number shown on the die. If a child lands on a season tile of the same color that player may keep it. The first player to collect one tile from each season wins.

24350.name: Take Two!
24350.description:
From the Box:

"Take Two! is a fun-filled game for 2 or more that's a new game every time you play. Arrange tiles randomly on the board, then start grabbing. Everyone plays at once, grabbing matched pairs off the ends of the rows until the board is empty. Whoever has the most matched pairs wins. But choose carefully--and take a second look, because some pieces look almost alike. If just one pair is mismatched, you lose."

This is best described as multi-player version of Mah Jong (solitaire version). It has a very frantic pace as everyone races to grab tiles. Comes with a board with affixed plastic rows to keep the tiles in line, and 124 domino quality tiles.

24359.name: Slumber Party
24359.description:
One in a series of sixteen Flipsiders games designed to resemble pastel colored audio cassettes. The game contained a metal gameboard that would flip out with the snap of the wrist. A storage compartment at the top of the game would hold the magnetic pawns. A spring-loaded switch would spin the wheels of the cassette to generate random numbers and events during play. The game would hang from a blister pack on display at the store.

Every time you hit your opponent she gets closer to bedtime. The object is to stall bedtime as long as possible.

24362.name: Alien Assault
24362.description:
One in a series of sixteen Flipsiders games designed to resemble pastel colored audio cassettes. The game contained a metal gameboard that would flip out with the snap of the wrist. A storage compartment at the top of the game would hold the magnetic pawns. A spring-loaded switch would spin the wheels of the cassette to generate random numbers and events during play. The game would hang from a blister pack on display at the store.

Players must advance toward and defeat in battle the boss alien on three levels to win. Defeat means starting a level all over again.

24363.name: Caterpillar Causeway
24363.description:
One in a series of sixteen Flipsiders games designed to resemble pastel colored audio cassettes. The game contained a metal gameboard that would flip out with the snap of the wrist. A storage compartment at the top of the game would hold the magnetic pawns. A spring-loaded switch would spin the wheels of the cassette to generate random numbers and events during play. The game would hang from a blister pack on display at the store.

Chute and Ladders (AKA Snakes and Ladders) adapted to fit the Flipsiders format.

24364.name: Gold Fever
24364.description:
One in a series of sixteen Flipsiders games designed to resemble pastel colored audio cassettes. The game contained a metal gameboard that would flip out with the snap of the wrist. A storage compartment at the top of the game would hold the magnetic pawns. A spring-loaded switch would spin the wheels of the cassette to generate random numbers and events during play. The game would hang from a blister pack on display at the store.

The left spinner tells how far the players may advance during a turn. The right spinner tells the player whether or not one may advance when one reaches a barrier. The first to complete four trips through the mine is the winner.

24365.name: Prized Pony
24365.description:
One in a series of sixteen Flipsiders games designed to resemble pastel colored audio cassettes. The game contained a metal gameboard that would flip out with the snap of the wrist. A storage compartment at the top of the game would hold the magnetic pawns. A spring-loaded switch would spin the wheels of the cassette to generate random numbers and events during play. The game would hang from a blister pack on display at the store.

Players take turns using the right spinner to advance their board marker. When a player reaches a jump, the player must use the left spinner to determine if the jump is successful. The winner is the first player to complete all four rounds of the steeplechase.

24366.name: River Run
24366.description:
One in a series of sixteen Flipsiders games designed to resemble pastel colored audio cassettes. The game contained a metal gameboard that would flip out with the snap of the wrist. A storage compartment at the top of the game would hold the magnetic pawns. A spring-loaded switch would spin the wheels of the cassette to generate random numbers and events during play. The game would hang from a blister pack on display at the store.

The left spinner is used to indicate upstream and downstream movement. The right spinner is used to indicate distance moved. The first player to reach the finish line is the winner.

24367.name: Sweet and Sour: The Chinese Restaurant Game
24367.description: A dexterity game that requires the players to use chopsticks to move small pieces around.

24368.description:
Expansion for BWAH!! the BANG!! based card game set in the "Firefly" Universe. This expansion allows for up to 11 players as well as contains options rules and Episode cards based on the different episodes of the show. These cards have a wide range of effects. Optional rules include cards based on the shows gag reel, its cancellation by Fox and its movie deal. Rules for a 2 or 3 person game are included as well.

Expands:

BWAH!
24368.name: BWAH!: Gorram Plans

24369.description:
Another expansion for BWAH!! which is based on the game BANG!! set in the "Firefly" Universe. This one includes 18 new characters and 18 new actions cards as well as rule and card clarification.

Expands:

BWAH!
24369.name: BWAH!: Local Color

24370.description:
A very small expansion for BWAH!! which is based on the game BANG!! but set in the "Firefly" universe. Based on a short bit by one character in the first episode of the show this set add 3 characters, 2 are plastic dinos and the other is a new Wash card. Also there are a 2 new action cards, a new location and a new episode card.

Expands:

BWAH!
24370.name: BWAH!: This Land

24371.description: A stand alone BWAH!! game that can be combined with the original if desired. BWAH! Can't Stop the Signal is based on the game BANG!! but set in the "Firefly" universe created by Joss Whedon. This one is based on the movie "Serenity" and not directly the show. The game uses the same mechanics as BWAH! and BANG! except the characters and professions are from the movie. Some examples are Wash, Zoe, and Mal as characters and Psychic, Crew, Captain, Reavers, and Operative as professions. Health is recovered by eating Fruity Oaty Bars.
24371.name: BWAH! Can't Stop the Signal

24372.name: Bloodbath at the Sakarya, August, 1921
24372.description:
BLOODBATH simulates the horrific, turning point, battle in the Greek attack towards Ankara in August, 1921. The Greek Army had been unstoppable up to now and the Turks were reeling back to the last stand defenses in the hills just across the Sakarya River. Their morale had taken a serious blow, so serious, that orders were to shoot any Turk soldier caught fleeing during the battle. The Greeks paused for two weeks before advancing across the river, giving the Turks time to build a two lines of defenses. Greek divisions averaged 10,000 men, while Turk divisions averaged 5000. Both sides were feeling the pinch of supply issues, both quite determined to crush the other. If the Greeks won, Ankara, Turkey's new capitol, would fall and perhaps part of Turkey would become part of Greece. The battle and war all reached this pivotal situation, critical to both sides. It would be bloody--over 18,000 died on the hills from August 23 to 30.

Game scale: 12 hr. turns, battalions. Each hex is around 400 yds. Owners of The Great Attack 1922 will easily assimilate the rules, although there are some new ones to learn.

The game comes with one 11x17 inch map, 280 counters and rulebook.

Related game:
Bir Buyuk Turk Saldiri

24373.name: Bumper Car Arena
24373.description:
Bumper Car Arena is OGP's first full blown board game. Earlier offerings were more along the Cheapass Game quality of components. In this game, the components are quite good. This is a race game with pre-programmed movement ala Roborally. Players also score points for knocking into their opponents. The last place player also controls the "rogue" bumper car, Jimmy Fudge -- who only wants to bump other players.

Each player controls one bumper car. Simultaneous movement card play determines the movement order. Players score points for moving around the track in the appropriate direction, and for bumping other bumper cars. Draws are done from a face up draft of n+1 cards where n is the number of players. The remaining card is used to control Jimmy Fudge's bumper car. Play continues until someone has scored 21 points, thereafter, there is an increasing chance of the game ending every turn.

From the Publisher:

It's a beautiful day at the amusement park. You and your friends have decided to take over the bumper car ride for your own purposes. Players score points for bumping other players cars and going around the track in the proper direction. (Going backwards makes the carnies angry.) And who is this Jimmy Fudge kid anyway?

24374.description:
Expansion to the base Arclight game with a focus on the creatures that inhabit space.

Expands:

Arclight
24374.name: Arclight: Close Encounters in Nearspace

24375.name: Mississippi -- The Speed Boat Race
24375.description: A simple spin and move game on the Mississippi River. The speedboat pieces are kind of nice, but the massive, upright roulette style spinner is the highlight of the game.

24376.description:
From publisher Parker Brothers: Rewind the decade of yuppies, big hair and break dancing! This edition of the popular trivia game has cool retro packaging and 2400 trivia questions in six categories to take you back to the colorful 80s! Includes 4 collectible tokens based on 80s icons. For 2-4 players or teams.

Categories in this edition are headlines, television, movies, music, sports & leisure, and wild card.
24376.name: Trivial Pursuit: Totally 80s Edition

24377.description: This Mini or Pocket Pack was made for use with the Trivial Pursuit Pocket Player Set Game but also featured color coded questions for use with the regular Trivial Pursuit games. This set contains 120 sports themed cards: "From baseball to bullfighting - With an emphasis on recent times."
24377.name: Trivial Pursuit Mini Pack: Sports

24379.name: Celebrity Head
24379.description:
Very closely related to What's That on My Head?, and Hedbanz: Identity Crisis Game.

The object is to guess your celebrity name first and win the game. Your celebrity name is in a card in a headband that is placed on your head.

The play - first, you wear a headband that has a randomly selected celebrity name card inserted into the slot. The oldest player then spins the spinner and moves his meeple to the appropriate position on the board. If you land on the "ask a question" space, you get to ask the other players a yes/no question about the celebrity name on your head. If you get it right, you get to spin again. If not, the play moves clockwise. There is a space for asking two questions, losing a turn or receiving a "big hint". The player reads the "big hint" question on the card and the group is allowed to respond beyond yes/no. The player then ends his turn.

If you guess your celebrity name wrong, you still get to keep on playing, you place a new, random celebrity name into your headband.

There are also blank cards so you can write in other people's names who may only be celebrities in your world.

24380.name: Hunters in the Sky
24380.description:
Hunters in the Sky is a complete miniatures game of WWII air combat. The basic rules allow for relatively large battles with up to a dozen aircraft per side and minimal record keeping.

Optional rules are included which cover; air to ground combat, bombers (dive, level and torpedo), variable pilot quality and experience, and simple campaign system.

Advanced rules which add realism include; advanced maneuvering, deflection shooting, visual spotting, limited ammunition, critical damage, and more...

Also included is the Warbirds aircraft lists, with game stats for 118 different aircraft from 10 different nations.
28 pages.

"Hunters in the sky is by far the best WWII aircraft game I have ever played! If you do not have this in your collection then SHAME ON YOU! BUY IT NOW!" - R.A. June 2006

Download version can be purchased at www.wargamedownloads.com

24381.name: Special Forces
24381.description:
Counter-Terrorist Warfare in the Modern Age

Special Forces is a miniatures game of close combat in the modern era. Inspired by first-person shooter computer games such as Delta Force and Rainbow Six, he rules are designed for small scale battles with one or two dozen figures per side.

Special Forces is easy to learn and fast playing, with an emphasis on playability. It includes rules for infantry action and vehicles and comes with two sample scenarios; Columbian Crack-Down and Hostage Rescue - Iraq.

13 pages

Download version can be found at www.wargamedownloads.com

35718.name: McWiz Junior Booster Bus: The Bus of Knowledge in Math

24383.description:
From Dr. Toy:

"There are 1,200 questions included in this innovative game. It is available in French and English. This game is perfect for children 6 and over. There are three questions on each card: one is aimed at younger children (6-7 yrs.) the second aimed for older(8-9 yrs) and the third aimed for 10 to 12 years old children. Everyone at all ages can play the game together. The first player or team to complete the jigsaw puzzle wins. Most questions are based on actual school textbooks."

Expanded by:

McWiz Junior Booster Bus: The Bus of Knowledge in Math
24383.name: McWiz Junior

24384.name: Amazing Animal Trivia Game
24384.description:
From Dr. Toy:

"This game allows children to delve into the world of animals and will fascinate them for a long time. Children can collect sets of cards. There are 200 multiple choice and true/false trivia questions. In order to have a turn, you must correctly answer on the card drawn. Excellent graphics on each card make the animals sharp and interesting to look at."

24385.name: Word for Word Reading Rods
24385.description:
From Discovery Toys:

"In a fast-paced race against the clock, build as many words as you can and strengthen phonics and spelling skills. Players at different reading levels can play at the same time using specified combinations of colored rods. Or practice with basic word families, rhyming words and blended sounds at your own pace with the included activity book (used in schools to teach reading). Especially helpful for kinesthetic and visual learners."

24386.name: Fractions Supreme Pizza Game
24386.description:
From Discovery Toys:

"Pizza parts make a "whole" lot of fun. Help children visualize and understand the concept of fractions, using a favorite food and a fun strategy game. Game variations challenge players to master fraction equivalencies, addition and more."

24387.description:
From the Publisher's Website at http://www.hyperion-games.com/dil01.html **



"The Dilbert Principle:
The most ineffective workers are systematically moved to the place where they can do the least damage: management.

Welcome to the absurdities of the business world: a place of rightsizing, vision statements, bungee bosses, peer reviews, total quality management and team-building exercises; a place where millennia of evolution is put to use in the struggle for the best cubicle and competition over office furniture.

In Dilbert™ the Board Game you and up to five friends toil in an office of evil HR directors, accounting trolls, canine consultants, and a boss who bears a suspicious resemblance to the devil. Every project assigned to you is doomed from the start, so your best bet is to dump it on someone else or try to get it killed before it eats away any more of your life. In fact, the only thing that really matters in the end is your own happiness. So why bother with work?

Dilbert™ is a hilarious board game for 3-6 players ages 14 and up, and requires about 90 minutes to play. "
24387.name: Dilbert: The Board Game

24388.name: Paparazzi
24388.description:
The theme

On a beach in St Tropez, some celebrities are having a nude midnight swim. But the paparazzi are here! It's a mad scramble to find your clothes in the dark before the flashes of the cameras.


The game

Each player is one of 8 possible celebrities. All the clothes and accessories of the celebrities are shuffled and dealt out on the table. You have a few moments to memorize the positions of the clothes before the lights are switched off.

In the dark, the icons in the corner of the cards glow. You can tell its a pair of underpants, but whose shoes are they? You can switch around the cards to try to confuse the other players. At any moment, anyone could switch on the lights and then it's "freeze!" as the celebrities' pictures are splashed across the front page of every gossip magazine.

You get "embarrassment" points for being naked, or for wearing someone else's clothes.

24389.name: Wildlife Bingo Game
24389.description:
The first matching game using wildlife photos which were taken directly from DK's best selling children's books.

Classic bingo is only one of the variations which are described in the rules pamphlet, as young players are challenged to work on matching, sorting, and language skills

A perfect first game for the children...

24390.name: Mens erger je niet!: Kaartspel
24390.description:
Card version roughly simulating the endgame situation in vanilla "Mens erger je niet!" / "Ne t'en fais pas!" (a "Pachisi" / "Parcheesi" clone), the object being to 'bring the pawns home'.

Each player has an identical pack of 24 cards, in one of 4 colors. There are 4 sets of 6 cards with each set having a die value printed on the cards: 1 through 4. The cards within a set have a number of colored pawns on them, 1 through 6, and have to be played onto their 'home' pile in that order.

The object is to play out all your cards onto the 4 'home' piles while hampering your opponent.

Card play is done "Shut the box" style, where the eyes on a standard D6 determine the total value of cards that may be played onto their 'home' piles. A [6] rolled allows for another die roll and play of cards.
The pawns printed on the cards come into play when hampering the opponent. When one of the 'home' piles -represented by the dice- reaches the same size -represented by the pawns- as the opponent's identical pile, the opponent has to empty that 'home' pile.

Winner is the player who 'brings all pawns home' first.

24391.name: Stargo
24391.description:
From the Rules of Play:

STARGO is a fun and engaging way to introduce kids to the basic concepts of stars, galaxies and constellations. There are two ways to play, and both are based on Bingo. Version "A" uses basic number and color concepts as players search for stars on one constellation. Version "B" uses basic visual and memory skills as players enjoy traditional Bingo on a grid featuring 24 constellations.




Version A:

There are 30 large glossy cards, each featuring a constellation with numbered, colored stars (that glow in the dark!). Each player selects one. Colored and numbered stars are selected from the bag and called -- first to complete his constellation wins.

Version B:

On the flip side of the constellation cards is a traditional Bingo grid of constellations. Constellations are selected from a deck (each has information about that constellation on the back). First to complete five in a row wins.




The constellation cards feature glow in the dark stars and an orienting arrow. Combined with the included compass, they can be used to help find those constellations in the night sky. The smaller cards contain facts about the constellations and the stars within them. The rulebook also contains information about stargazing.

24392.name: Road Rally
24392.description:
One in a series of sixteen Flipsiders games designed to resemble pastel colored audio cassettes. The game contained a metal gameboard that would flip out with the snap of the wrist. A storage compartment at the top of the game would hold the magnetic pawns. A spring-loaded switch would spin the wheels of the cassette to generate random numbers and events during play. The game would hang from a blister pack on display at the store.

The spinners determine how far one may move during one’s turn. The players will compete in three races and the first to complete all three races is the winner.

24393.name: Die Angelschlacht 1944
24393.description:
Die Angelschlacht (the pivotal battle) 1944 covers the 25th SS PG\12SS Panzer division's counterattack on June 7th against the strung out Canadian forces west of Caen. The 12thSS struck with 45 tanks and quickly advanced causing a panic to the allies. The Canadians had little armor and were out of artillery range. The battle lasted 6 hours and the SS advanced only a few miles but this attack delayed the allied advance for another 30 days! The game has over 280 counters and one 11x17" map, rulebook. Include in the game are unique random events that makes game play never the same. For those interested in historical or what games, player's may choose to do either. The game contains many scenarios.

Each hex is 200-250 yds, each turn is 30 min. Units are company level, each with a morale and movement rating. Actual fire strengths depend on the unit firing, type of attack, range to target, and weapon firing. New rules cover random events, anti-aircraft fire, air units, M10's, Panther tanks.

24394.description:
By August 1919, the British 45th and 46th Battalions, together with over seven river monitors and gunboats mounting up to 9" guns, over 25 aircraft (mostly DH9A bombers) were in place for the final blow on the Red virus known as Bolshevism. By this time, the French and Americans had all left. It was now a British show and one that was destined to leave a bloody nose upon the Reds. At least that was the plan! As the troops gathered along both sides of the Dvina River (the river was very large), the opposing forces were as determined. The Reds fielded the 3rd Brigade\18th Division amounting to the 160, 161, 162 Regiments, numerous large artillery barges, six fighter aircraft, many gunboats, lots of mines, trenches. The overconfident British had not factored in the effects of Mother Nature, which as the battle wore on, smiled too often on the Red forces. Clearing BOTH sides of this major river ( think Mississippi) and advancing hundreds of miles to Kotlas (the main Red base) in hindsight, seemed like a crazy idea, but at the time, was a tempting objective. And so it was. The Dvina River Offensive had it all: dogfighting aircraft, ground combat, naval surface action, naval bombardment, bombing, machine guns, artillery, river monitors and gunboats, unpredictable river currents, water levels, sandbars, floating mines sent down by the Reds, foul weather, balloons. The offensive lasted four days. One part went extraordinarily well-another part nosedived into hell-both sides get to enjoy this game!

Game scale is 750 yds a hex, turns are 12 hrs, 10 in all. Ground units are platoons, artillery batteries, single aircraft include: Sopwith, Spad, Avro, DH9A, Re 8, Neuiport, M20 and Short. River ships include: monitors, gunboats, each representing one ship. Ground units include Lewis guns, MG, Stokes mortars, leaders, infantry. There are two game maps, one covers the ground action and the other the air to air combat at a different scale (50 yd a hex). Aircraft are rated for speed, bombing, size, maneuver, altitude. Thus, the game is really two games: an operational ground game, a tactical naval and air to air combat game!
24394.name: The Dvina River Offensive: Final Blows in North Russia, August 1919

24395.description:
Rare German Space Battle System based on the famous German Sci-Fi Novels.

German box text: "Wollten Sie schon immer einmal hinter dem Kommandopult des Schlachtschiffes STARDUST Platz nehmen und den Stolz der terranischen Raumflotte persönlich ins Gefecht führen? Jetzt ist es möglich........

Als erstes einer Reihe von Spielen mit dem Hintergrund der weltbekannten Perry Rhodan-Serie erhältlich - das Raumkampfsystem! Ein neuartiges, leicht zu handhabendes Regelsystem ermöglicht eine "realistische" und detailgetreue Simulation von Geschehnissen, wie sie für ein Gefecht in den endlosen Weiten des Weltraums typisch sind. Ob zwei einzelne Raumer ein Duell miteinander ausfechten oder ganze Verbände aufeinander prallen sollen, können Sie selbst entscheiden, und auch sonst sind Sie es, der die Entscheidungen trifft..

Taktische Bewegung, Abbremsen oder Beschleunigen, Kurztransition oder Notsprung, Salven, Punktfeuer oder volle Breitseite, alles lieggt in Ihrer Hand. Als Spielmaterial steht Ihnen dabei eine Spielfläche von 59 x 42 cm, ein Regelband, ein Szenarioband, ein Satz Datenblätter, 56 Seiten Hintergrundmaterial, 180 Spielsteine und zwei zwanzigseitige Würfel zur Verfügung."

Add-Ons were:
- Das Combatsystem
- Protektorat von Norgas
- Das Solare Imperium
- Die Raumflotte der Druuf
- Die Raumflotte der Maahks I
- Die Raumflotte der Terraner II
- Die Raumflotte von Alt-Arkon
- Arkon's Robotflotte
- Der topsidische Gila-Kreuzer
- Die terranische Kaulquappe
- Pedlar - Handelsraumer der Springer
- Spezialkreuzer California
- Roboter
24395.name: Perry Rhodan Simulation

24396.description:
From the website:

The goal of War on Terror, the boardgame is to liberate the world, ridding it of fear and terrorism forever. Naturally, only the biggest and strongest Empires are up to this task and so a certain amount of dominance needs to be proved. Alternatively, you can play as the terrorists, fighting for a world without empires.

Everyone starts the game as an Empire, with a couple of free villages and they can settle anywhere in the world. Although peaceful (we had to ban fighting in the first round) the 'politics' of the game already start to form, depending on what oil is discovered and how 'aggressive' the initial settlement choice is.

Empires then spread over the planet grabbing all available land, searching for the best oil and the most strategic borders. Some go for towns and cities, other spend their cash on extra empire cards, building up their political options. Maybe, if they're lucky, they'll get an early nuke.

Sooner or later someone takes a pop. Maybe the Axis of Evil has declared an Empire evil, giving them a few terrorist cards which are just too tempting not to play. Maybe someone is looking too strong already. Maybe you've got a grudge from a previous game or maybe you just want to win. Either way, war is declared or the terrorists strike!

Although it is possible to win the game with all the players still playing as Empires, the more likely outcome is that Empires are destroyed, bankrupted, or simply cave in and become terrorist players. As more empires fall they work together as a single terrorist player. With each new influx of terrorist cards and cash for the terrorist cause, the remaining Empires begin to wish that maybe they shouldn't have funded quite so much terrorism as they did.
24396.name: War on Terror

24397.description:
Critical Hit's newest Advanced Squad Leader compatible game extension covers the fighting in Korea in 1950.

Contents include:
Two sheets of die-cut variant counters, representing all the SMC and MMC counters, plus AFVs and guns, that you will need to play the game IN NEW FULL COLOR FORMAT, including CCF Buglers, grenade squads, USMC in Winter Uniforms, and much more;
A large historical game map on heavyweight stock;
8 scenarios printed on cardstock
PLUS TWO BONUS scenarios
VARIANT Rules and a PLATOON LEADER campaign game;
The scenarios and CG are fought on a colorful map depicting the rugged terrain found on the Korean Peninsula. This expansion is the first of Critical Hit's products to feature full color counters.

This is not a stand alone game. You must have the ASL Rulebook and any other ASL module (Beyond Valor) for the necessary game markers in order to play.

Visit www.criticalhit.com for more information
24397.name: Escape from Chosin: Toktong Pass 1950

24398.name: Switch
24398.description: Switch is the first of the small box games published by Pseudon and is noted with "#1" on the spine. The game includes 16 tiles which are first laid out for all to see. The tiles are then flipped, and in turn a player must flip two to find the scoring combinations on the score sheet. The winner of the game is the first to make all the combinations on their score sheet.

24399.name: Retire-E-Z-Z-Z
24399.description: "A New Twist to the Popular Card Game Hearts!" boasts the cover. In fact, the game is essentially Hearts with a retirement theme. There are 40 cards, 10 each in 4 suits. The black & white artwork on each card depicts various advantages to retirement (more time, relaxation, etc.) The lead player lays down a card. Players must follow suit if possible. High card in the suit led takes the trick and that player lays the next card. The person with the least points at the end of the game is the winner. The cards are packed in a box that could easily hold nine times as many.

24400.name: Captain Morgan's Wrath
24400.description: Captain Morgan's Wrath is the pirate drinking game by Party Hard Corps. Spinning a tee-totum (think a dreidel), the players are encouraged to be as loud with their yaaaaars as possible while the it spins, or even bang on the table to try to make a player "walk the plank!" First player with five doubloons and the captain's patch is the commodore, and the winner- unless the crew mutinies, and leaves that land lubber on an uncharted island!

24401.name: Cult
24401.description: Cult: The Drinking Game of Politics in an Esoteric Order is the first game by Party Hard Corps. The players take on the roles of cultists in an occult group, vying for political influence on their way to illumination. One player, the Messiah- whose signifying ring could be passed on at any turn- gets to declare what the cult worships (and therefore what rules are in play). A party game of fast drinking and fast dice rolling.

24403.name: Agribizz
24403.description: Players begin with 4,000 dollars and have the chance to make a fortune or go broke by investing in farms and farm related businesses. A property can be purchased only by landing on it and each time a player must decide whether to invest his limited funds or to hope for something better among the 28 farms and 9 businesses available along the track. Cheaper properties are easier to develop but have a smaller payoff when landed on by an opponent. (just like Monopoly). Another decision must be made regarding the 3 different kinds of crops that may be planted on each farm. Again cheaper pays off sooner but in smaller amounts. Once the crop is in a player can add farm equipment in the form of plastic "silo sections" which are piled in strict color sequence. Limited quantities of the best crops and the highest silo section adds to the decision making process. A player may mortgage a property to pay debt or to make other investments and can still collect 10% of his normal fee from a visiting opponent. Other features include taxes, becoming incorporated, luck cards which can be disastrous, selling properties to an opponent or the treasury.

24404.description:
From Dr. Toy

"This game incorporates the traditional Scrabble Jr. game, but is played like a crossword puzzle, featuring baby animals and wildlife found in National Parks. Kid-sized words and colorful pictures of animals make it fun to match letter tiles to words on two playful crossword grids. One side features wildlife, while the other side features the environment included is an endangered animal coloring book featuring facts about endangered wildlife."
24404.name: Scrabble Junior: Wildlife

24405.description: This game features 96 "domino" tiles, consisting of different pairings of the 12 zodiac symbols. Each symbol appears red and black. Twelve of the tiles have stars at one end and are "wild". 2 to 4 players play, each using a rack of 6 tiles. Tiles can be placed anywhere in the layout provided that they match the same symbol in opposite color of at least one face that has been previously played. Notches on the tiles help keep the layout securely in place. The score for a play depends on the number of matches which, in rare cases, can be as many as 6. If a player can make a match on at least one face of his tile he may play a second or third and so on up to all 6 tiles from his hand. Play ends when, after all the tiles have been drawn a player clears his rack, earning a bonus. High score wins
24405.name: Zodiac Match

24406.name: Inspiration
24406.description:
Inspiration is one of Wolfgang Kramer’s not so well-known games, which he designed together with his wife Ursula. It is a party game in the vein of Taboo or Activity, although the players do not paraphrase terms or play charades. Rather, the players try to solve picture puzzles faster than their opponents. In each round, one of the players acts as the moderator and chooses two picture cards, that together represent a two part noun (e.g. ball game (cards 73 and 20) or treasure chamber (cards 54 and 104)). The player may choose between asking an easy, medium or difficult question. Then the other players try to solve the puzzle, while a sand timer runs down. Depending on the difficulty, the player who calls out the correct answer first, may advance 2, 3, or 4 spaces on the track. The first player to reach the goal is the winner.
Inspiration features a clever card index box, to keep the picture cards organized and two bookmarks to quickly find where to put back the previously selected cards.

24407.name: Millennium: Das Jahrtausendspiel
24407.description:
“Millennium – the millennium game” (as it would be literally - and rather silly - translated into English) is a memory game with a twist meets a historical trivia game. The game board shows an event, an important person or anything characteristic for each decade from 10 to 2000 (with the exception of 500, 1000 and 1500) represented in nice comic art as well as text and arranged in a huge spiral covering almost the complete board.
At the beginning of the game, the players cover 10 of the decades one by one with cardboard disks numbered from 1 to 10, while reading out the year and the accompanying text. E.g. “10 Emperor Augustus”, “1060 William the Conqueror”, “1190 The third Crusade” or “1770 The USA”.
Each player then gets ten transparent plastic chips. The goal of the game is to get rid of these chips by correctly remembering the events etc. under the numbered cardboard disks. In each turn, initially the player rolls a d12. Then he has to repeat the decade and the text under the corresponding disk. Only if he succeeds, he may return one chip to the box and replace the disk on a new decade; in any case, the next player gets to roll the die. The 11 and 12 on the die have special functions:
When rolling 11, the player may place one of his chips on a cardboard disk of his choice. The next player who rolls the corresponding number has to take this chip before trying to remember what is underneath.
When rolling 12, the player asks the player with the most chips left to remember what is under a disk of his choice. If the other player succeeds, he may place one of his chips on the disk and replace the disk, otherwise, the first player has to solve the task. If he does not succeed either, the player with the most chips may give him one of his chips.
Apart from the material described, Millennium contains a small almanac (30 pg.) with a short description of each decades event, person etc.

24408.name: Script
24408.description: Script is the third of the small box games published by Pseudon and is noted with "#3" on the spine, and it is a word game. The game consists of a set of letter tiles each with a number, as in Scrabble. The unique thing about the game is that over the course of the game players must come up with 20 words each beginning with a different letter of the alphabet, and all the words must be different.

24409.name: Opus
24409.description: Opus is the third of the larger box games published by Pseudon. It is a musical game where players must match cards showing styles of music in the right combinations to score points. The board is quite nice-looking with spaces for cards on the top and musical staffs below that identify the combinations to be made.

24410.description:
From the publisher. Treasures & Traps is the adventure card game that puts you on a quest for riches. Each card can open the door to a tricky challenge, a magical assistance, or a valuable treasure.

The approximate playing time is 10-30 minutes for two players. Add 10 minutes for each additional player.

Be the first player to get a Gold, Silver, and Bronze TREASURE card into your realm. Your other cards give you the powers you will need to keep others from winning.

The game contains a full set of 100 unique Treasures and Traps Cards.

Nominated as an ORIGINS AWARDS finalist (2006) for Non-Collectible Card Game of the Year.

Box Size : 118mm x 90mm x 18mm
24410.name: Treasures & Traps

24411.name: Erfenis
24411.description: Old Lord Humbug is rich. More than 600 years of thriftiness and savings in the family has left the Lord with considerable property, stocks, many family heirlooms and 100 million English pounds that will be distributed to the family members when the Lord dies. However, all of the heirs have already waited a very long time: the old Lord refuses to die! He is already 86 and could live another 100 years! The possible heirs are: the sparing sister Lady Scrape Humbug, the poor old friend of the family Sir Humpty, Trickenham the butler, Miss Fuzzy the careless daughter, Spoiler Humbug the prodigal son, and Vanity the ambitious mistress. They each try in every way possible to influence the old man, in an effort to win the him over and get the inheritance for themselves. Players in this game take the part of these heirs are.

24412.name: Track-Gammon
24412.description: Track-Gammon is a backgammon-like game. Each player has five pieces of different sizes; the pieces must move out of the start in increasing order of size, but must enter the goal space in decreasing order of size.

24413.name: Subsidie
24413.description: Subsidie is a quick card game for 3 to 6 players and the players try to win projects with government grants. In addition several obstacles must be overcome: grants can be lost, somebody else can take over the project, the project can fail due to scandal... The purpose of the play is to apply enough government funds as possible for the realization of projects. The winner is who at the end of the play has applied the largest amount subsidy for realized projects.

24414.description: ConXion is an abstract game using hexagonal tiles. The game is primarily for three players (it can also be played by two or six). The object is to connect the opposing sides of the board in your color with the center. Tiles must be placed so they connect to the center. Instead of placing one of their tiles, a player can rotate anyone's tile, which can change the connectivity considerably.
24414.name: ConXion

24415.name: Käpt'n Jan
24415.description: Captain John is always busy sailing his ship transporting goods from far and wide. This is no easy task, because sometimes the parcels are long and thin, sometimes they have lots of corners or they are simply round. Now and then a great wave splashes onto the ship and sweeps a chest overboard. However, it is sometimes possible for the captain to fish the chest back on board again. If he maneuvers his ship well, the captain will manage to get all the goods to their destination safe and sound.

26552.name: Santy Anno: Blackbeard at the Pub

24416.description:
Description from the publisher:

You are one of the notorious pirates of the Santy Anno, the terrifying three-master that makes the Caribbean seas insecure. After a long night drinking rum and partying, you have forgotten where your ship is and, even worse, who is your captain!

To resolve this, actually very common problem in a pirate’s life, the pirate’s guild has initiated a new tradition: the first 3 on board will respectively become captain and first mates. The ones arriving too late will be demoted to ship’s boys and spend the rest of the trip cleaning the deck!

Will you be fast and smart enough to avoid being spending the rest of your time with brush and bucket instead of sword and gun?

Avoid to be demoted and get a maximum of ducats. At the end of the game (5 rounds) the player with the most money is nominated captain and wins. The next 2 are his first mates. The others lose and have to pay for the next round… and to clean the table and glasses!

This is a pirate game. The 500 first copies will come with a limited Ex-ludis signed by the designer along with the expansion Santy Anno: Blackbeard at the Pub.

Expanded by:

Santy Anno: Blackbeard at the Pub
24416.name: Santy Anno

boardgamehonor.12823: 2007 International Gamers Awards - General Strategy; Multi-player Nominee

24417.description:
Players attempt to build the most successful factory to produce the best products by connecting input and output reservoirs smartly to your machines to build the most profitable factory!

Players each start with a unique empty factory floor with a support pillar in the middle. During the game you purchase machines to place in your factory. Each machine takes 1 to 3 inputs from reservoirs (yellow, blue, red, and brown) and produces one output (of the same colors, or black end products). You must always connect all reservoirs and machines correctly by using the connectors (the pipelines). At the start this is easy, but becomes more puzzling during the game.

Players start with one of each color reservoir, and can sometimes acquire additional reservoirs. On the machine-tiles you see the revenue of each machine. Connecting machines to each other (input on output) makes more advanced products which brings extra profit. But building connectors and reservoirs costs money and you must try to have the most money at the end.

It was originally published by Cwali for 2-4 players, and later reprinted by Z-Man in a larger box with components for 2-5 players.


Cwali edition (2006)

Contents: 4 factories - 48 machines - 47 reservoirs - 129 connectors - 4 relief pillars - 4 colored discs - 25 transparent discs - 1 money track

Artwork: Marco Jeurissen

From BoardgameNews:

The number of players is listed as 2-4(+) - the "+" means you can use additional copies of the game to add players (four more for each additional copy). Cwali's website for the game provides a fifth player board. The website also offers a solitaire variant of the game.


Z-Man edition (2010)

Contents: 5 factories (double sided original/expert) - 55 machines; includes Factory Fun Expansion 1
Artwork: Karim Chakroun, Franck Moutoucoumaro
24417.name: Factory Fun

24418.name: Toccato
24418.description: Toccato is a 3-D abstract game that uses 12 poly-forms that can be made into a cube. Players must place and remove the stones to score in specific patterns.

24419.name: Felsberger Arena
24419.description: Felsburger Arena is a fast-action dexterity game played on a hexagonal board. Players flick marbles into the center felted play area to score points and knock opponents' marbles out. Made to the same high quality standards as the rest of the Felsburger lineup.

24420.name: Riegel
24420.description:
Riegel, which was designed by Paul Schobesberger (Austria), is an abstract game played on wooden board with 10 roes of sliders. Each row has depressions to hold marbles. Each player is trying to get their set of marbles from one side of the board to the other, but can only move onto certain depressions and thus the sliders must be positioned properly for movement. Made by Felsberger in the same high quality as their other games.

It is not an abstract strategy game since the moves are decided by dice according to http://toy-net.ch/felsberger/spielregeln/riegel.htm .

24421.name: Felsberger Nuggets
24421.description: Felsburger Nuggets in an abstract game made in the same high quality wooden format as the rest of the Felsburger lineup. The game uses four colored turntables each housing up to four marbles, and players must rotate the turntables to make color matches to remove the marbles.

24422.name: Labyrinth
24422.description: The Felsberger Labyrinth is a beautifully made game that plays very well. The high-quality board houses a set of movable channels and as expected the goal is to get the ball to flow the way you want it to. The board sits on a stand that allows it to tilt in all any direction. Like all the Felsburger games, it is expensive.

24423.name: Hamertjesspel
24423.description:
Hamertjesspel (Dutch for "The Little Mallet Game") is a traditional pub-game that was popular in the Low Lands of Belgium and the Netherlands and can be traced back as far as 1750. It could be regarded as an early form of Pinball, but despite its erstwhile popularity, it was all but forgotten in the latter half of the 20th century. Recently replica boards are making a bit of a comeback, and "het Hamertjesspel" can be seen again at village fêtes and other occasions that encourage nostalgic throw-back entertainment.

Four players sit on each side of a square wooden board with raised edges, defending their goal. A marble or small lead ball is dropped in the centre, either by hand or, on the more evolved board versions, through a "fair" central dropping device. Players try to get the marble into an opponent's goal, and keep their own one safe, by using a small wooden mallet ("Hamer" is Dutch for "Hammer"). To make life difficult for the players, the goal is split up in two by a centre isle, and spanned by a rail, so that it is impossible to block both halves simultaneously, or swap the hammer between goal sides easily. The board itself has a few obstacles (usually exposed nails) that deflect the marble. Game play is best typified as frantic fun.

The boards tend to have a slight slope towards the centre point. The square versions commonly use 4 wood sections in a pyramid style. The "Karrewiel" (Cart Wheel), which is the round board version usually had more panes to create a nicer circular slope. Occasionally it would also be able to accommodate more than the standard 4 players, or have each player's goal area split in three gaps, rather than two. Most boards would have only one marble in play, but, reportedly, there are variants that had multiple balls simultaneously in the battle arena. If less people were playing, parts of the board could be blocked off using temporary wooden walls.

Traditionally, the first player to lose a certain amount of goals would have to buy the next round. Like all pub games, it was also played for money, and onlookers placed bets on the game's outcome.

In 1995 Battle Dome appeared, which is a modern flipper version of this traditional game, with a few added bells and whistles. In 2000 Felsburger produced the traditional Karrewiel version under the name Chüngel. Needless to say, most versions of the game keep coming from the Low Lands wood crafts cottage industry, that is slowly "rediscovering" this lost gem. And since the dimensions have never been standardised, quality and appearance are as diverse as the woodworkers making them.

24424.description: 50 different Sudoku challenges. Three different ways to play: Standard, Challenge and Solitaire Sudoku.
24424.name: Challenge Sudoku

24425.description:
Hab Acht ("Pay Attention") is a interesting memory variant, because it's motifs are printed on both sides of the tiles! There are 9 motifs printed on 36 tiles. Each front has a different backside, which means that every possible front/back-side is included in this game. Each motif is also printed on 9 task-tiles and every player draws 1 task-tile before the game begins.

Object of the game is to reveal all 8 motifs which match the task-tile. This can be quite difficult, especially, when you not also try to find "your" 8 motifs, but when you simultaneously try to inhibit certain motifs to come up, which apparently are being sought after from some of your opponents...
24425.name: Hab acht!

24426.name: Glückstreffer
24426.description: Glückstreffer ("Lucky Strike") is a Yahtzee variant, which makes use not only of usual dice numbers, but also of the colors they show. Every dice is printed with 1 red, blue, yellow and green side plus 2 sides in black. Accordingly, there are 6 dice used instead of the normal 5, so that it's possible to throw a row from 1-6 in every color.

24428.name: Weltkonferenz
24428.description:
The wife of the French President is found dead in her room. Who killed her?

All players (6 male, 3 female (+ 1 m/f)) should act out their roles to solve the mystery, because one of the guests is the murderer.

24429.name: Straßenfest
24429.description:
A computer shop-owner was found in his shop in a pool of blood. Who is the murder from the street party?

All players (4 male, 5 female (+ 1 m/f)) should act out their roles to solve the mystery, because one of the guests is the murderer.

24430.name: Fußball: Fieber
24430.description:
One soccer star is kidnapped, and the kidnapper has killed people as well. Who hates Soccer enough to do this at the World Cup?

All players (5 male, 6 female (+ 1 m/f)) should act out their roles to solve the mystery, because one of the guests is the murderer

24431.name: Geburtstagsparty
24431.description:
Frida has her birthday party, and her sister gets sick and goes to the bathroom. When they check on her later, she's found in a pool of blood. What's happening here?

All players (9 male, 3 female (+ 1 m/f)) should act out their roles to solve the mystery, because one of the guests is the murderer.

24432.name: Hochzeit Mattenklotz
24432.description:
Jürgen and Colette are getting married today, but just before the ceremony Colette disappears. Where is she?

All players (4 male, 4 female (+ 1 m/f)) should act out their roles to solve the mystery, because one of the guests is the murderer.

24433.name: Mord im Leuchtturm
24433.description:
Frank Mohn was found dead in this room. Who of the other hotel gusts knows more that the others?

All players (7 male, 4 female (+ 1 m/f)) should act out their roles to solve the mystery, because one of the guests is the murderer

24434.name: WIM
24434.description:
"the every which way word game" (tm)

Players compete to score the most points by forming interlocking words in all directions, using square letter tiles, most of which can be used in more than one direction or as more than one letter.

WIM consists of 96 letter tiles, tile racks, and a letter bag. There is no board.

There are 19 distinct tiles which make the 26 letters plus the blank tile. Eight of the tiles are ambiguous and can be read as two different letters, depending on orientation. For example, an upside-down A is a V, and a sideways N is a Z. Three of the tiles may be used as the same letter in more than one orientation (O, S, and X). A tile may be used as different letters in different words at the same time, even in the same play.

Each letter has a different value and scores are calculated according to the letter played. Players receive bonuses for using a previously-played tile as a letter it wasn't used as previously, for changing the orientation of a word, or for using all seven tiles on their rack in a single play.

Home Page: http://www.puzzazz.com/wim

24435.name: Proverbial Wisdom Junior
24435.description: This is a simplified version of Proverbial Wisdom. There are three types of challenges for players: try to sketching, acting or define a saying. Comes with a spinner, card tray with sketch cards, picture cards and definition cards, clue hider, timer and sketch board. The first team to collect three of each card type wins.

24436.description: This unique product will help your child to develop a respect for and understanding of Native American life. Contents include a carrying pouch, seven horses of the RedFly Sacred Circle game, colored paper, twelve star stones, one medicine wheel, numerical playing cards, instruction sheet and other pieces. Collect one of each colored teepee place cards as you travel around the Red Fly Sacred Circle. It is a cooperative game. The game is completed as a team effort with all players participating. The game ends when the last star stone is placed.
24436.name: Seven Horses of the Redfly Sacred Circle

24437.name: Toads of Fun
24437.description: Players move their toads around the lily pond catching flies based on matching a color and a number on the spinner to the same color and number on the lily pads. Analytical thinking skills are used when players control the bumblebee and get to consider different possible places to put the bee and what consequence each possible choice might have. This game includes six toads, 36 flies, one bee, and a board with two spinners, game board showing pond with lily pads, SPLASH spots and logs.

24438.description:
The field is laid out on a 30 by 21 grid. Play alternates between the Offense and the Defense. The ball is advanced by passing dribbling and heading. When a defensive man is within specific distances from the ball and attempt can be made to tackle or intercept. The result is determined by throwing a die, but strategic placement of the men can affect the odds. Goal tries are similarly determined by die throws adjusted to the positioning of the goalkeeper and other defensive players.

From Designer's Notes:
KICK-OFF Soccer has been developed to follow as closely as possible the real game of soccer. The strategy and tactics are the same, as are most of the rules. Soccer is not a complicated game. There are very few set plays, these mainly arise on Corners, Free-Kicks and Throw-Ins. The game is played through with the skills, flair and innovation of individual players working together as a team. And so with "KICK-OFF", by using simple Basic Moves, the flair and innovation has been left up to the individual player.
After playing one or two games of "KICK-OFF", the method of play becomes easy and only brief reference is necessary to player and ball movement, and die throws. The die throws do not determine the outcome of the game, they merely simulate the chances played in real soccer.
"KICK-OFF" has been play tested by enthusiastic "youngsters" aged from eleven to adult. For the young enthusiasts, some adult assistance was found advisable at first, but once advised, they were at home with "KICK-OFF" as they were on the real field!
24438.name: Kick Off Soccer

197697.name: Netherlands (fan expansion of Ticket to Ride)

24439.description:
Ticket to Ride: USA 1910 is a card expansion for the original Ticket to Ride boardgame, winner of the 2004 Spiel des Jahres. It contains 181 large format cards (the same size as Ticket to Ride: Europe and Ticket to Ride: Märklin). This includes 35 new 1910 Destination Tickets, a GlobeTrotter Bonus card for completing the most tickets, 4 Mystery Train Destination Tickets originally provided in the Ticket to Ride: Mystery Train Expansion expansion, and a complete replacement deck of the 141 cards from the original game deck (30 Destination Tickets (4 cards have a reduced value from Ticket to Ride), 110 Train Cards, and 1 Longest Route Bonus Card (Trans America Express)).

The rulebook is from the original game designer Alan R. Moon that gives you three additional different ways to play the game:

The 1910 Rules: Played as the standard Ticket to Ride, but using only the 1910 Destination Tickets, and GlobeTrotter Bonus card.
The Big Cities Rules: Played with only the newly identified 35 "Big City" Destination Tickets (15 Standard Tickets, 19 1910 Tickets, and 1 Mystery Train Ticket).
The Mega Game: featuring all of the game's Destination Tickets and Bonus Cards (30 Standard Tickets, 35 1910 Tickets, 4 Mystery Train Tickets, and both Bonus cards).




Part of Ticket to Ride series.
24439.name: Ticket to Ride: USA 1910

24440.name: Felsberger Tara
24440.description: Tara is the newest Felsberger game and follows in their tradition of well-made wooden dexterity games. The games uses a color-sided die used to select pieces that are manipulated on the playing surface. A blend of strategy and dexterity.

24441.name: POTS! The Game
24441.description: Set in Classical Athens, players bid against each other to acquire the biggest and best collection of vases, as they travel round the key areas of the city. Good judgment and a pinch of luck are needed, but even then the gods of Mount Olympus may intervene to help or hinder you. [Taken from the game's website.]

24442.name: Sudoku Dice
24442.description: A multi-player game based on the popular Sudoku puzzles. Players roll dice to show which numbers can be placed on the common grid. Numbers must be placed within legal Sudoku guidelines. Cards are used to re-arrange tiles and force other events. Players score each time they can complete a row, column, or box. A variant allows players to identify if a placement would cause the puzzle to become unsolvable.

24443.name: Idol Quest
24443.description:
Enter a Mysterious Land of 3D Adventure!
In the middle of a lake deep in a jungle, a centuries-old Idol sits atop an ancient tower. It’s a race to see who will be the first player to build a path across the lake and up the tower, seize the priceless Idol and escape to a waiting boat. But dangers lurk on every turn -- your opponent might block your escape route or steal the Idol from you -- or even bury your Explorer under a stone block!

The Strategy Game of Capture and Escape
Using a team of Explorers and an array of action cards, place blocks across the lake to create a 3D path to the top of the tower. With each roll of the die, your Explorers get closer to the Idol. If you draw the right card, you can leap ahead of the other players, steal an opponent’s card or send a player back to the start. But the game can change in a heartbeat -– your Explorers might be stranded on the shore or buried beneath a block -- so every move requires strategy and planning.

The first player to reach the top of the tower, capture the Idol and escape to a waiting boat wins.

Idol QuestTM is fast-paced fun for the entire family!

24444.name: Sequenz
24444.description:
The game has 4 sets of 20 thick wooden tiles in 4 colors, which are numbered from 1-20. The 4x5 fields of the board also show the numbers 1-20.

Object of the game is to score the most points, but these points are given at the end of the game only! The game ends when all 80 tiles are placed on the board, but only the top tiles are valued; adjacent tiles of the same color give bonus points.

To reduce the influence of luck, the hand of 10 tiles is not filled randomly, but can be taken from 10 open tiles. Anyway, it's a game where you need a good memory, because you should remember which tiles have been played already and thus can't help you getting some bonus points.

This game is very easy to learn and play, but it's not so easy to find the best strategy.

24445.name: Dynamite
24445.description:
snip from introduction:
" The Draw-Place deck face down in center of table. Each player draws one card at a time. First one to draw a dynamite card is the dealer.

The Deal-The cars are dealt one at a time beginning at left. With two players, deal seven cards to each. After all hands are dealt, dealer turns up the top card and leaves the deck face down beside it.

Object of Play-To get rid of all cards in your hand. the first player to succeed wins that round and the others must record their score according to the cards left in their hand."
